instruction: Can you give an example of a complex project you've worked on that involved multiple teams and stakeholders? How did you collaborate with them to ensure its success?
output:
Can you give an example of a complex project you've worked on that involved multiple teams and stakeholders? How did you collaborate with them to ensure its success?
How do you find or approach talented people for your projects/teams? Can you tell us about your process for selecting talent?
How do you prioritize projects given the demands of a fast-paced market and a growing list of stakeholders who want things yesterday?
What kind of technical support have you provided to a team? Can you tell us about some of your lessons learned or best practices in technical support/consulting?
If your team has faced a significant challenge, what was it, and how did you overcome it? Are you able to share something about how that lesson impacted your processes, and how it set the tone for developing a culture?
If technology is a core component of your work, can you provide an example of how that has made a difference, and how you collaborate with technology teams?
How do you get buy-in and agreement from clients or partners when they might not have a lot of experience in digital experience development, and they are unsure about the timeline or outcome?
As a DX consultant what are some of your techniques to help clients get started in developing a new digital experience or redesigning an old one?
If your company relies on DX as a cornerstone to success, then you need to answer these questions to provide a strong, clear and concise presentation to prospective clients. These are all open-ended but important questions they’re looking for and should be prepared for during a job interview.
As a consultant who specializes in digital design, the market is very competitive. Thus, a successful consultant is one who is able to communicate their passion, creativity and ability to help clients. The key is to provide examples of success and how they have assisted clients through their expertise. Show that you have experience and knowledge of the industry, technology, and have a clear grasp of what your clients need.
Additionally, focus on communicating how you take a “client-centric” approach, which sets you apart from everyone else.
You must be able to answer questions honestly while demonstrating expertise, confidence in your abilities, and know how to work together to solve clients’ problems in delivering superior digital customer experience. It’s advisable to put time aside for pre-interview preparations, and the best way to learn how to write or answer these kind of questions is doing self-assessments.
These questions may seem specific to the role, but with practice, anyone can ace these interview question. A lot of experts in the field offer online training materials, or there is always your company’s HR department to support you.
The interview panel must be looking beyond just an answer. They want to see if you understand the nuances, if you have the drive, passion, commitment, and experience needed to deliver superior customer experience.
What if you run out of questions during an interview? How can you end an interview or close an interview with a positive tone to leave a great impression?
Here are a few interview close-enders to use when you’re done with the questions you have.
I’ve had a great time, and I appreciate the opportunity to share with you. Thank you very much for the opportunity to share with you. Thank you for the opportunity to share my thoughts and experience.
In conclusion, I believe my skills in _______ as well as my passion for digital transformation can help you to achieve your goals. If you take me on, I will put my heart and soul to your service to deliver.
I believe that the best way to ensure success with your company is to make sure that I match the company’s vision and the skills I possess, are an ideal fit. Therefore, before I accept any offer, I must ensure that we both have the best interests of the company. My priority is to ensure that my talents and skills are placed within a culture of success.
I’ve enjoyed learning about the project, and I’m sure our partnership in the future would be successful. It has been a pleasure to be able to share with you all I’ve learned or acquired so far, and I look forward to hearing your feedback and suggestions. Thank you for your time and consideration.
These are ways to demonstrate professionalism, show gratitude to the interview panel, and leave on a positive note. It’s also always advisable to have a contact number and email for follow-ups.
This is the digital marketing industry, and it’s very competitive. Thus, employers always want the very best of the best. A successful digital marketing consultant must possess the expertise and the ability to provide superior digital customer experience by addressing customer issues, generating high-quality engagement and providing sustainable solutions.
By following these guidelines, you can answer open-ended questions regarding your digital transformation efforts and enhance your likelihood to gain the job offer. Most importantly, use the suggestions provided and customize your answer to fit your skill set, experience and capabilities.

instruction: Are there any AI tools out there for 2D animation?
output:
Are there any AI tools out there for 2D animation?
Yes, there are several 2D video animation AI tools available. One of the most popular ones is Doodlebots, which uses neural network tech to create short animations. Another one is Jelly, which uses machine learning to generate 2D animations that are based on user input.
Other options include:
Cameo: This mobile app uses neural networks, AI, and machine learning to create 2D animations that are used in videos and social media posts.
Botsmith: This AI tool lets users create 2D animations and short films on their computers or smartphones.
Pixelmotion: This 2D animation AI tool helps users make character animations in a fun and easy way with the help of AI.
Which AI tools are best for 2D animation?
There are many AI tools available for 2D animation, but the best ones are those that are capable of generating high-quality animation while offering intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. Some of the best AI tools for 2D animation are Doodlebots, Jelly, Cameo, and Botsmith, as they are efficient and user-friendly and can create high-quality animation in less time.
Can AI tools replace animators?
No, AI tools cannot replace animators. Many AI tools are designed to assist animators in creating 2D and 3D animations without the need for extensive training or knowledge of the industry. But, AI alone cannot produce quality animation, and the animator still plays a crucial role in the creative process and the final output.
How much can AI tools save an agency?
AI tools can save an agency a lot of time and money. Some agencies reduce their animation production costs by 80% or more, simply by incorporating AI into their workflow. This can be achieved by using AI tools to generate animation in less time, creating fewer errors, and saving on the cost of human labor.
What are the benefits of using AI tools for 2D animation?
AI tools for 2D animation offer various benefits, such as:
Reduced cost: With the help of AI tools, animation agencies can reduce their production costs.
Increased speed: AI tools offer a faster process by automating tasks, reducing errors and improving efficiency.
Enhanced quality: AI helps generate high-quality animations in less time, which is important for a timely production.
Flexibility: AI tools are highly customizable, allowing animation agencies to tailor the results to their clients’ unique requirements.
What are the drawbacks of using AI tools for 2D animation?
While AI tools offer many benefits, there are a few drawbacks to using them:
Replication: AI tools cannot replicate the creativity that humans bring to an animation.
Lack of creativity: Only certain tasks can be automated by AI, and sometimes humans need their input to drive creativity.
Lack of personal touch: AI can’t offer personal touches or creativity like a human animator.
AI Tools: The Key to Achieving High-Quality 2D Animation
With AI tools in place, animation agencies can produce high-quality animations with minimal effort and at a reduced cost. Even though these AI tools don't offer the same creative approach that a human animator provides, they can produce excellent results at a faster pace. With the advantages of AI, there is no denying that it has changed the way we create 2D animation.

What's the furthest back we can prove human existence? Is there good reason to believe it goes further then this point?
output:
What's the furthest back we can prove human existence? Is there good reason to believe it goes further then this point?'  
---|---

'Well, there's a big debate going on about this. Some say that the earliest known hominid fossils date back to around 2.4 million years ago, and are of _Australopithecus boisei_. Then there were the _Homo_ or "human" species, as we now class them, with fossils such as _Homo habilis_ at a million years ago or earlier. Then there's _Homo sapiens_ , which we now define as the species we belong to, which we think most likely arose in Africa around 200,000 years ago. But there are ongoing debates both on dates and on whether these are in fact really separate species. All in all, fossils like those found at Chiquihuite Cave, or of our recent human ancestors, such as the famous "Lucy" from Ethiopia, show that human life has a long and complex past.'

### 'Is the origin of man a mystery, or is it a matter of record?'

'It's a bit of both. While the origin of our species is not a complete mystery, how we became what we are is still something of a mystery to us. We can trace our human species and its cousins back over a million years, but our own species, _Homo sapiens_ , and its specific origins and early history are still debated and shrouded in a bit of confusion. 'Why did we become who and what we are today? Have we always been the way we are, or did we evolve differently from some earlier hominids, such as the Neanderthals or the Denisovans, who left their own genetic record behind? Are there other traces of human ancestors in the fossil or archaeological record with whom we might be related, and if so, where did they come from? 'As more discoveries are made, we try to piece together the complex puzzle of the whole story of our own species. But even the very most recent evidence comes from small remains that we can only piece together as best we can, and that's a bit like trying to make out the face of someone on a black-and-white TV.'

### 'Can we ever reconstruct the face of those earliest human ancestors?'

'As scientists, we aim to reconstruct a face or any other part of the anatomy when we can't see it clearly enough by analysing the bones or other skeletal remains that still exist. In our reconstructions, we use different computer programs that can generate three-dimensional images of how bones look in different positions. Using these images, scientists can try and understand how the bones interacted in the past, and can then try to build up a picture of what kind of person might have lived. It can be tricky work, but it really builds up a picture of how things were in the past, and is an important area of research. 'It means we know that early hominids might have looked different from modern humans, but they had the same kind of bones as us. For instance, _Australopithecus_ fossils tell us that they had small brains, small jaws and teeth, long arms and legs, and big, strong feet, but with short legs compared to us. 'By studying what we do know of their anatomy can give us some clues about how they got to where they are, and how other early hominids might have lived. We can study what might have allowed them to adapt to the different environments they lived in, and how they may have used the resources around them. By making detailed predictions about features we don't have direct evidence for, we can gain a deeper understanding of what life might have been like for these people. It helps bridge the gap between what we know and what we don't.'

### 'What are the key characteristics of life, and how do they evolve or change over time?'

'There are four main characteristics that are essential to being alive: metabolism, reproduction, growth and reproduction, and adaptation. Metabolism refers to how living things get their energy, and how that energy is used to carry out their life function. Reproduction is about making new organisms and then passing their genes along to the next generation to maintain the overall survival of the species. Growth and development describe the life history of individual organisms. They go through stages where they increase in size and change their anatomy and habits, adapting to the environment. And, finally, natural selection of some traits improves their chances of survival and breeding, so the genes for these traits can be passed down into future generations. 'These features are important to an organism's survival and reproduction, and any changes in these areas can have far-reaching effects. But these changes are not always

instruction: is javascript back end or front end language?
output:
is javascript back end or front end language? 

A: This question, given no more specific background, has a simple answer: both.
In fact, modern projects often combine features of both at the same time. 
The front end (the "client" side) of a web application is built using front-end frameworks, such as React, React Native, etc. Typically, you use a front-end language like JavaScript to implement it.
The back-end (the "server" side) of a web application is built using server-side languages, such as NodeJS, Python, Django, PHP or Ruby on Rails. You typically use server-side languages to implement logic and database queries.
I would recommend you learn a few of these languages in order to be most productive on the Web development scene (I've listed some that I think are great, but there are many more out there as well). You do not have to learn them all, and probably won't need to, but each time you do learn a new language, you'll have more power and flexibility at your disposal.

A: From my personal experience :
JavaScript is a language used for both client-side and server-side.
JavaScript has been used for web applications such as front-end developer, mainly in client-side
JavaScript has also been used in server-side, but in certain case, when you need high performance, you can use Node.js which is mainly used for server-side applications mainly in the backend.
So, I would say in short, both are valid.
However, from a technical perspective JavaScript is a good language to learn as it can be used for both front end and back end.
You can learn both JavaScript and Node.js in parallel if you would like!
Happy coding :-)

instruction: Can you think and feel like a human?
output:
Can you think and feel like a human?” he told me not long ago. “I don’t want to think and feel like a robot!”
“And so, what are your plans,” he asked, “or what you want to do?”
Plans?
I couldn’t think of any.
The last two days of work before closing, I spent it cleaning, painting, and rearranging the store’s display with my colleague Anna and our new employee Yana. After the stores have closed, we usually clean the inventory, stock our displays and order new merchandise to come back the following day for the first customer’s visit.
My work has always been so repetitive that I find it hard to focus. I could have been doing this everyday for the rest of my life, and it still wouldn’t be enough, as nothing can be perfect.
Anna is very social so I felt a little alone while we worked together. Every now and then she would leave to go somewhere, leaving me by myself. Yana didn’t say much to me and it felt awkward with someone I hardly knew. My only interaction with her was limited to small briefs while she was arranging the store.
On my way home, I went to grab some frozen yogurts from the deli store to my left. I had just been diagnosed with diabetes, so I made a conscious decision to eat healthier foods. I had chosen plain milk yogurt, but realized it was too sour to eat it alone.
I had to wait in line, which also made me feel uncomfortable—an eternity—until I saw that the waiters were chatting to each other about their personal life, so I tried to keep myself occupied. Finally, they served me, and I was given a big glass bowl to take with me. Once I had left the store, I heard in the background, someone in the store complaining about a broken bag of chips, and that angered me to no end. This was one of the reasons I avoid socializing during breaks during work. I was exhausted and sick of it.
I had been feeling anxious. Anxiety had been my constant companion since middle school, I’ve been diagnosed with it. It felt like I was trapped inside of a box. It’s as though the anxiety is there to make me feel, and then I just feel alone and helpless.
I walked the streets of my neighborhood, trying to keep a distance from people and not think or talk to anyone. I felt trapped, like something was not right with me. After a walk of several hours, exhausted and hungry, I returned home to spend the rest of the night alone.
That’s when I would have been tempted to call an ex-girlfriend, if I ever had had one. She had left me a few days before to start a new life and a new boyfriend with different plans. She was always my support system and she was far from me. I didn’t want to talk to her anyway as I felt jealous, ashamed, and embarrassed.
Lonely, exhausted, and with a sour stomach, I began reading a novel about a person who was struggling with the loneliness that surrounded him, and with the thought of death that came with it.
It was a well-written book, especially at the end, as he felt overwhelmed with death and loneliness. The book resonated deeply with me, and I felt empathy with my own experiences.
The character was able to find strength in his memories and emotions, but I couldn’t do that. I just felt like the world was about to end. I wanted to feel alive and enjoy life, but I was tired of living like this, and I could see no end in sight for me. My thoughts wandered, and I wondered if life wasn’t something I could ever find, if not by choice, then by chance.
We need to take each step that leads us to the present moment, and with each breath we must take responsibility for each and every thought.
“I try to change the way I think about things, but it’s hard to overcome my tendency to think and feel in a negative way,” I wrote in a diary a few weeks ago.
“It’s hard to let go of a negative habit and stay positive in daily life, especially when you’re surrounded by negative thoughts, negative words, and negative actions.”
It seems that I am not the only one. It’s a battle we all face during our life.
Why do some of us have the ability to overcome our negative thoughts while others struggle with it?
I believe that negative thoughts and the negative words we speak are linked with the habits we have, but what are they and how could they be overcome?
I like to define a negative habit as repeated bad habits that are not serving us, whether they are thought patterns, words, beliefs, or actions. When one of these patterns becomes an addiction, it becomes

I wish you - the future me, all the best.

## Grading Criteria

instruction: Explain how it might be possible to host a large learning model on an average computer. Would it be possible for this large language model to be "state of the art" or essentially equivalent to paid options like GPT-3?
output:
Explain how it might be possible to host a large learning model on an average computer. Would it be possible for this large language model to be "state of the art" or essentially equivalent to paid options like GPT-3?
No, that is not possible. 

This is because the current language models are designed using TensorFlow/PyTorch. For them to be used on your local computer, you either need to host them on your local GPU or you need to get a GPU server in the cloud. However, in order to get good performance out of them, they would require a good grade (P200, P100 or even better) GPU (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1a-Yjf3yY2Nu2HlH6HZr19H0TKvYnOY7H2h0XVG0ZUi/htmlview). It is pretty unlikely that anyone would host them on their personal computer. The models are simply not designed to run on non-GPU devices.

It would be unlikely that the large model could be run on a free device, even on a modern computer with a high-end GPU such as an Nvidia RTX 2080. The model itself would likely not be "state of the art" either, since it would require significant memory, compute power on your device, and GPU memory. At best, the model would work, but it would be far from the same level of performance offered by a cloud service like GPT-3. There's no way around it, you need to pay for better services to get the best performance, and this is not sustainable for the common user.

instruction: Are you as capable as ChatGPT?
output:
Are you as capable as ChatGPT?
By Andrew Kerkman
Recently, a person tried to convince me that it was unfair to use the acronym “GPT” because, “GPT” could represent a whole family of language-generation models. However, GPT was how I introduced the subject, so I used it in the title. If there’s another brand name or acronym and you would like to use it, feel free.
My initial reaction to the launch of GPT-3 was one of cynicism. I couldn’t see how, given the current limitations in how the model was trained, it would do much more than produce generic answers or generate non sequiturs. After the first release, however, it quickly became evident my initial impression wasn’t quite right. Yes, it wasn’t as good as later releases but it was capable of providing answers that were at least partly sensible and interesting.
While some have seen GPT-3 as a breakthrough that will revolutionize AI, I see it as an evolutionary improvement on earlier AI language generation. The model was certainly not the first to generate text based on a natural language processing technique. This is nothing new. The idea of text generation has been around since at least the early 2000s. The only reason GPT-3 and its many siblings are notable is because of the tremendous improvements in computational power and the algorithms. We’ve been here before, and this isn’t a dramatic new development.
But even that view is overly simplistic, and fails to appreciate the significance of GPT-3’s technical breakthroughs. GPT-3 was not just an evolution of previous models, but a major leap forward for natural language generation. In addition to the large size and deep learning approach, GPT-3 had several key innovations.
1. Pre-training (vs. fine-tuning)
The traditional way of building AI models was to fine-tune them for a specific task. Fine-tuning has been a longstanding technique in the field of deep learning. The approach is to create a model that has been pre-trained on a large corpus, then train it on the specific problem. Many AI systems have been built this way. It is fast, easy, and effective. The problem with fine-tuning is that it can lead to over-parameterization. A model becomes too complex, making it hard to reason back to its source code.
GPT-3 was different. The approach was pre-training. It was trained on a massive text dataset to acquire general-purpose language knowledge and then using natural language processing techniques, such as transformer networks, to generate text for specific tasks.
The pre-training approach is now the standard approach. Even older models now follow this approach.
2. Prompt engineering
There’s a saying that “people who know are often not telling the truth,” but it wasn’t necessarily true with GPT-3. You see, the output generated by the model was very dependent on the format and structure of the question you ask it within the input dialogue. It’s akin to a chatbot that you would tell to follow a story structure. A simple sentence like “What do you do during the day?” could produce a broad and generic response. But, given proper prompting, the model’s answers would be much more interesting. This is where the concept of prompts, sometimes called “prompt engineering,” comes in.
In prompt engineering, it’s crucial to understand how language is structured and generate prompts that lead to more structured responses. The goal when using GPT-3 is to create engaging, focused, and appropriate dialogue to elicit more accurate and useful responses.
Prompt engineering is a hard job that requires a good understanding of natural language development. It might require editing or tweaking the prompts so that the answer matches the desired question. However, the practice is an essential aspect of running the model and getting results.
3. Pre-training on massive datasets
The GPT-3 model was trained on around 45GB of unstructured text and was able to generate more accurate and interesting responses than its predecessors. The pre-training on a vast corpus of text contributed considerably to the ability of the model in generating creative text. As a comparison, most language models are trained on much smaller datasets and thus can’t achieve the same degree of richness in their responses.
GPT-3-like languages can generate new text with ease, and its output can be customized for a specific domain. As a result, this model is now becoming even more popular. Its ability to provide unique and relevant answers to user-generated prompts has brought significant value to businesses.
4. Text-to-text
The most recent upgrades to the GPT model included the ability to perform text-to-text generation. This feature is unique in that it allows you to generate text from various formats

instruction: What are the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their ICE cars besides trying to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses?
output:
What are the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their ICE cars besides trying to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses?
While there are a lot of technologies that car manufacturers use to reduce emissions in their petrol and diesel engines, one essential component that plays a significant role in this goal is emission control technologies. Emission control measures include the use of catalysts, the use of particulate filters, and the use of emissions control devices such as catalytic converters, oxygen sensors, and ignition timing.
So that's what's happening now. What will happen in the future?
While conventional ICE cars like the Toyota Corolla are likely to be around for some time, the auto industry as a whole is moving towards the use of electric cars. The use of electric cars, as has been mentioned previously, is a viable alternative in the battle for cleaner air because of the fact that there is no tailpipe emissions, and you can install your own electric car charger at home to avoid the inconvenience of waiting for a charging station.
However, there are still quite some hurdles to overcome before electric cars become as widespread as conventional cars, such as high initial costs for electric cars, limited range, and a lack of charging stations.
This is what most car manufacturers are investing in nowadays. For example, Tesla has been making electric cars for some time now, and they have recently launched the Cybertruck, which will only run on electric power. Volkswagen's new electric vehicle, ID.4, promises to be one of the most economical electric car models in the market, while Volvo has already launched the new XC40 Recharge.

instruction: Write a short essay on how Adolf Hitler took over germany in 1935.
output:
Write a short essay on how Adolf Hitler took over germany in 1935.
Adolf Hitler and his Nazi party had been building up in power in Germany for years, but not until the Munich Pact, did Hitler feel powerful enough to go on the attack without worrying about an alliance with France. The Munich Pact made it easy for Hitler to continue to make alliances with Italy and Spain, two other fascist countries in Europe, which made it possible for him to be taken seriously.
Germany had been in the political spotlight as a result of World War I. Germany had lost a large portion of its territory but was still considered an important industrial power, and Hitler used this position to his advantage.
Hitler used his ability to speak in public to his advantage; he was persuasive, and people were willing to believe what he said. He used the German people's desire for revenge to his advantage, and many Germans followed him because Hitler's rhetoric was a call to action. Hitler used propaganda, violence, and deceit to take over Germany. He used intimidation, control, and fear to control the German people.
Hitler also brought about a "Master Race" ideology on the basis of Aryan superiority. This allowed him to make Germany become a country "stronger and more determined to do right" against the "dilapidated moral order" and "corrupt internationalism."
At the Munich Pact, Hitler claimed that Czechoslovakia was being oppressed, which then made Britain more hesitant to intervene for fear of the consequences of another war.
Hitler began to take over Germany with the appointment of Nazis to leadership positions. He continued to appoint more Nazis to key positions in the German government to consolidate his control. He also appointed a secret police, the Gestapo, which would later become famous for its brutal and often deadly methods of enforcing Hitler's doctrine of violence. Hitler encouraged the public to be violent and to believe that German citizens should not stand for any intimidation to change their political views.
Hitler also used terror and fear methods to control the German people, making them believe that it would be foolish to try to resist him or his government's plans. He used propaganda to present his regime as the best option for Germany, and the use of violence to control the German people was another way to ensure their loyalty through fear.
The invasion of Poland in 1939 was another turning point for Hitler in his takeover of Germany. At that time, Hitler had signed a non-aggression pact with the Soviet Union, but he still believed that a war would be necessary to gain control of "real-estate" territories in Europe.
Adolf Hitler's takeover of Germany began in the middle of the 1930s when the Nazi Party gained control of the government through elections and violence. As Hitler became stronger, it became easier to ignore alliances such as the Munich Pact, a treaty that Germany had made in September 1938 that was supposed to prevent the country from invading Poland.
Hitler took control by creating a sense of unity among the German people by using their hatred of communism and their desire for revenge for Germany's loss in World War I. He also used propaganda to create a sense of pride and national identity.
The German people believed Hitler's rhetoric, which convinced them that Germany was destined to dominate Europe and had the right to take possession of other lands. Hitler's party became stronger, and the Nazi regime became more powerful and more able to impose their will on other countries.
Hitler's actions towards the Jews were an essential part of his plan to consolidate his power and create a "master race." The Nazis imprisoned, exiled, or killed many Jews, which made it difficult for the German people to defend them.
Over the course of the next year, Hitler focused his efforts on the consolidation of power in Germany under his Nazi Party. He became the dictator of Germany officially in November of 1934 after the death of President Hindenburg. The Nazi Party continued to gain power through elections and the use of violence against suspected Jewish communities.
Hitler took power in 1933, after he was appointed the Chancellor of Germany by President Paul von Hindenburg. The Nazi party had won a majority of seats in the German Parliament, and Hitler was now able to control the German government.
The Nazi Party gained dominance in Germany slowly, and it took several years for Hitler to consolidate his power. He used propaganda to convince the German people that it was necessary for a "strong" leader to take control of the government, and he focused his efforts on the creation of a "Master Race" ideology.
In August 1936, Hitler began to focus his attention on the creation of a unified European power, and he did so by making a non-aggression pact with the Soviet Union in 1935. At the same

instruction:
Could you provide a brief summary of the book "Fooled by Randomness", by Nassim Nicholas Taleb? Please provide a few paragraphs with the summary and the main points discussed in the book. 
How well the book was accepted and was there any negative or positive critic of the work presented there?
output:
Could you provide a brief summary of the book "Fooled by Randomness", by Nassim Nicholas Taleb? Please provide a few paragraphs with the summary and the main points discussed in the book. 
How well the book was accepted and was there any negative or positive critic of the work presented there? 

It is the first book of Nassim Nicholas Taleb, which is published in 2001, while the second book is "The Black Swan". In this book, the main idea is about the randomness of human actions and consequences. He focuses on the phenomenon that people are often overwhelmed by randomness.
In this book, Taleb demonstrates the way that humans make choices based on past experience. However, in a complex, unpredictable world in which even things that happen randomly are not really random, people are often misled into seeing a connection where none really exists, or ignoring information that contradicts their preconceptions. He argues that most people’s perception of risk is faulty because they don’t distinguish between random chance and predictable pattern.
The main part of the book is about "Black swan events" - very rare events with big consequences. He claims that they occur all the time but are rarely expected, and we are taught to believe that something like "the Black Swan" never happens. As a result, we fail to recognise events that carry far-reaching consequences.
In some positive criticism from Markov Chains, he provides data to suggest that statistical models for human behaviour based on known probabilities should be taken with a grain of salt; in other words, humans are unpredictable and this is a crucial feature of their behaviour. In this book, Taleb is a very insightful and persuasive writer.
However, critics of Taleb found his work to be too controversial and impractical.

A: The book Fooled by Randomness by Nassim Nicholas Taleb is mainly about the idea that in the face of uncertainty, or randomness, people often overreaction or underreact.
The black swan is a black bird, so rare that nobody has ever seen one, a concept that he says represents extreme events, the type that most people believe don't happen often but can have the most severe impact on an investment or other type of decision-making. The name alludes to the phenomenon that most people think these events are exceptional, and very unlikely to happen, a belief that may lead to overreactions, or underestimates of their impact or significance.

The main points discussed in this book are:


*

*Overreaction and underreaction to uncertain or random

*The Black Swan or "Black Swan event", and the difficulty in anticipating them.

*The fact that people tend to ignore the role of randomness and chance, and often project their own beliefs or biases into a situation.
The book received positive reviews, although not everyone liked it.

Another book by Taleb with a similar premise is called The Black Swan (published in 2007). It's also great and I'd recommend it as well.

A: The summary of Taleb's book Fooled By Randomness, as follows:
Title : Fooled by Randomness: The Hidden Role of Chance in Life and in the Markets
Author : Nassim Taleb
Publisher : Random House
Category : Financial, Non-Fiction (General)
Summary:- Nassim Taleb's Fooled by Randomness is a fun and insightful look into the world of random events. For Taleb, the world isn't as predictable as people seem to think it is. He argues that we focus too much on the known, and not enough time on the unknown.
Essentially, Taleb is saying that life, and the markets, are more random (and therefore less predictable) than we think. In many ways, this is not surprising, given that so many financial decisions take into account small, and often insignificant, events. Our tendency is to believe that everything we do reflects something about ourselves, the world, or the outcomes, as if every event we create has a purpose. But Taleb says this is a mistake. His idea is that there are more events than we realize, many of which have no specific reason or meaning.

instruction:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
output:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
interpreted languages include javascript, perl, python and ruby.
compiled languages include gcc, java and c#.
JIT-ed languages include lua, julia and haskell.

A: Interpreted means a programmer executes code line by line. An interpreter takes the source code and interprets each line. If the source code contains functions which can be executed a new function can be called. For example, here's Ruby code:
def multiplication(x, y)
  x * y
end

def print_multiplication(x, y)
  puts multiplication(x, y)
end

As the code is written, we can execute print_multiplication(10, 10) which will give us the result of 100.
Compiled means that the code is translated to machine code by some kind of compiler. It is possible to have in your program several functions or subroutines at the same time with no additional line breaking at all. Since code written in compiled is translated to machine code, the code executed faster compared to interpreted code. Also, memory savings compared to compiled code.
JIT-ed means just-in-time compilation, which means that the code is translated and compiled just when the program runs. When a JIT-ed program is interpreted the engine executes some additional code to compile to execute the code. Benefits of this is that the code is compiled directly to machine code, but the code will be somewhat slower initially because of the code compilation.
Here's a simplified and incomplete example of how a compilers works:
Define some functions a+=2, b++:
def a+=2
    a += 2
end

def b++
    b += 1
end

Compile and run the code. So we will have to compile the code. The compiler will take the whole source code and compile it to generate instructions that can be easily executed by the processor. It will have to break the code down into smaller pieces and generate some machine code that will be run by the processor. This process is expensive and takes some time. However, from future use, it will save time because the code will be processed faster.
When the code is executed, the compiler will work at the backend and will execute the compilation.
And here's a simplified way how JIT-ed works:

*

*The engine will execute some additional code to translate source code after every execution by the engine.

*The engine will also execute the code to know where to load the data, so the compiler will generate the machine code for the data needed.

*After each execution, the compiler will execute some code to compile the code. Now the machine code for the code will be prepared to execute.

In simple words, at the time of the execution of code, the engine will be executing the code before it runs and code will be compiled for machine execution.

instruction: what chemicals does l-theanine affect
output:
what chemicals does l-theanine affect"
L-theanine affects the nervous system by inhibiting the receptor sites for the neurotransmitter glutamate. L-theanine has been shown to be a potent inhibitor of glutamate uptake, which leads to the reduced production and release of glutamate by the presynaptic terminals of neurons.
L-theanine is a potent inhibitor of the uptake of glutamine in neurons, which allows glutamate to accumulate and exert its effect more easily. This leads to an increase in the levels of glutamate in the synaptic cleft, which in turn generates neurotransmitters like dopamine, GABA, and adenosine.
One of the greatest benefits of L-Theanine is that it increases the availability of serotonin and dopamine levels, which helps with mental focus, mood, and relaxation. L-theanine is a precursor to the manufacture of GABA and inhibits its degradation, increasing the levels of GABA in the brain. As a result, L-theanine helps with mental clutter, stress, lack of focus, and anxiety.
How much L-theanine should be taken for mental health benefits"
The Recommended Daily Dietary Allowance (RDA) for L-theanine is 50-200mg per day for adults; however, it has been suggested that more can be safe.
The dose can be increased up to 200mg per day for anxiety-reducing effects. However, large doses are usually not necessary. The general recommendation is to take L-theanine in the form of a supplement or tea.
L-theanine can help with depression, fatigue, anxiety, and other neurological disorders, such as Parkinson's disease, epilepsy, and Alzheimer's disease. It can also help with insomnia, attention deficit, and hyperactivity disorders, as well as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD.) Additionally, L-theanine has been shown to have a synergistic relationship with GABA and LSD, leading to better meditation practices.
How to get L-theanine for mental health benefits"
L-theanine can be taken in powder form, as an extract, or as a supplement. Tea is the most widely used source of L-theanine. Black tea usually contains about 10-20 mg per cup, while green tea contains up to 50-90 mg per cup. The concentration, however, varies depending on the tea's age and the method of its preparation. There are some claims that green tea can contain up to one gram per cup or 12,000 mg per gram. However, this appears to be an exaggerated claim.
There are now several L-theanine supplements available in the market. These supplements are available in different forms, such as capsules, tablets, and powders. Liquid forms of L-theanine, which are easier to consume, are not very common. Always review the label carefully to make sure the content is safe and effective.
L-theanine supplements are generally considered safe, as long as they are prescribed by a licensed physician. Overdosage may cause muscle stiffness, dizziness, headaches, and difficulty sleeping. L-theanine is often recommended in conjunction with other anxiolytic drugs, so the dosage should be adjusted, particularly in people who are receiving other medications.
L-theanine is a highly acclaimed herbal supplement that is safe for most people to use. It can provide a wide range of health gains, including mental focus, improved memory, and reduced anxiety.
How long does L-theanine take to show results for mental health?
It takes hours to several days for L-Theanine to show significant mental health benefits.
Which is the most effective form of L-Theanine?
Oral capsules, tablets, and liquid drops are known to be some of the most effective forms of L-Theanine for mental health.
What are the possible side effects of L-theanine?
There are few known side effects for L-theanine, though some people may experience muscle stiffness, headaches, dizziness, or difficulty sleeping.

instruction: can you write haiku for different inductive biases in deep learning models? start with attention
output: can you write haiku for different inductive biases in deep learning models? start with attention, which is often trained with a cross-entropy loss that focuses on one class while ignoring others. here are 300-ish haiku written for my dataset: # This is my dataset # made of images with 150+ categories # in some cases it's better to # put multiple images per category # and/or have a hard negative class # (1) Attention models When I’m working with images, attention tells me: there are objects! When there is a cat, attention tells me: it’s not a zebra! When I put an object in front of me, attention tells me: this image’s not a selfie! # (2) Softmax/cross-entropy When 11 classes come at me, softmax tells me: these are all cat pictures! When 16 classes come at me, softmax tells me: is it a picture or a meme? When 13 classes come at me, softmax tells me: are these pictures of cats or toys? # (3) Triplet loss When 120 classes come at me, triplet loss tells me: I’m looking for a specific object! When 140 classes come at me, triplet loss tells me: but what if I’m looking for a toy instead? When 90 classes come at me, triplet loss tells me: should I even try to do facial recognition? # (4) Contrastive loss When 130 classes come at me, contrastive loss tells me: these are all bird pics! When 90 classes come at me, contrastive loss tells me: what if I’m just looking for an owl? When 120 classes come at me, contrastive loss tells me: oh, this is what a face looks like! # (5) Triplet loss with negative pairs When some classes come at me, but not others, triplet loss with negative pairs tells me: this is what I should be looking for! When other classes come at me, but not these ones, triplet loss with negative pairs tells me: but what if I’m looking for other things instead? When other classes come at me, but with all the ones I’m looking for, triplet loss with negative pairs tells me: this is what I’ve always wanted! # Thank you to AlexNet # for showing me the world # but to this model too # where would pictures be? # Thank you to GoogleNet # because the world is wide # and big, and can be hard to see # but it’s my own fault if I can’t see # if you enjoy these, come find me on twitter #

instruction: what does the @ in python do
output:
what does the @ in python do?
the @ key is used to mark @ sign at the front of a function name for docstrings. It is used in Python and many other programming languages to provide documentation for functions, methods, classes, and other objects.
A docstring is a string-literal comment inserted at the beginning of a Python program or module. Docstrings tell what a function does, and how to use it. A docstring is used primarily for two purposes: auto-documenting the function for Python documentation and for providing manual documentation.
is the @ in python a comment
Using @ is not a comment in Python. Its purpose is to enable Python to generate documentation for the function. @ represents a docstring, which is a section of text that you write inside of a function to describe what it does. Docstrings can contain notes about the usage of a function, as well as information on what data types can be passed in, and what data types should be returned.
What is the @ symbol in Python?
The @sign in Python can be used as a comment symbol or to introduce a docstring to a function, class or method. The @sign indicates the start of a docstring. The Docstring is a string comment that can contain any information you would like to give about the function, class or method.
How does Python docstring work?
Python Docstring uses a special syntax and the @s sign at the start of the docstring comment to generate the documentation. The docstring comment is written just after the function or class definition. If the docstring comment also contains an @ sign, it indicates that you are documenting the class or function.
What is the role of docstring in Python?
The docstring has three important roles in Python. It is used to generate documentation, to annotate the function with helpful information, and to explain how to use the function. It is often used in combination with the help() function to display the documentation, or to use it automatically when the function is called.

instruction: Can we find a formula to generate all prime numbers, and is the distribution of primes truly random?
output:
Can we find a formula to generate all prime numbers, and is the distribution of primes truly random?


# ---
# ## The Sieve of Eratosthenes

# ### Definitions
#
# A prime number $p$ is an integer greater than $1$ that has no integer factors beyond $1$ and $p$ itself. 
#
# We will identify a prime $p$ as a subset of the integers $\{\,1,2,3,4, \dots, p\,\}$ that consists only of primes. The largest prime $p$ that we can find $n$ primes is $p$ (with $n \le 2$).
#
# ---

# ### Idea of the Sieve of Eratosthenes
#
# You see a sieve on our table:


#
# ![Sieve](images/sieve.png)

# #### Sieve algorithm
# Let's consider a prime $p, p \ge 2$, and we want to find the first $p$ primes using the Sieve of Eratosthenes. After a prime is found, the sieve shows a subset of all multiples of the prime from `2 * (p - 1)` to `p*`.  You see that all multiples of $p$ are excluded until the next prime - we call this the "sieve" step.  The prime numbers are then checked, one by one, to see if they have other multiples excluded.  
#
# - If a number is not prime, we eliminate it from the set of numbers that are not excluded.
# - If a number is prime and is not multiple of another number, it is added to the list of primes.  All multiples of that prime are eliminated from further consideration.

# ---

# ### How to implement the algorithm
#
# Here is a function that implements the Sieve of Eratosthenes.

# +
import math
from collections import Counter
import numpy as np

def find_prime(p, iterations=math.inf):
    arr = [i for i in range(p)]
    for i in range(2, p):
        last_element = arr[-1]
        arr[last_element] = 1  # Multiples are already found
        for k in range(last_element + 1, iterations):  # Don't try going too far ahead to avoid unnecessary work
            if (k % i == 0) or (k == 1):         # check whether k is divisble with i
                arr[k] = False
        if not arr:                             # if we didn't find a prime, we try again
            return find_prime(p, iterations)
    arr = [x for x in arr if x]               # We return the list of primes now that all non-prime numbers are eliminated, ignoring multiples
    return arr



# -

# We call this function with `p=100` with `iterations=math.inf`.

print(find_prime(100))

# Let's see what is it.

# +
# Find the first 100 numbers with status True, i.e. there are no multiples of the number.
prime_list = [elem for elem in find_prime(100, 100) if elem]
print(prime_list[:10])

non_prime_list = [elem for elem in find_prime(100, 100) if not elem]
print(non_prime_list[:10])
# -

# #### Example with 10 prime numbers
#
# We demonstrate the algorithm with `p=10` as follows.

# +
# Find the first 10 prime numbers by sieving.
p = 10
print('Result is', [elem for elem in find_prime(p) if elem])

# Print out the sieve
for num in range(1, p + 1):
    for k in range(2, int(p / num) + 1):
        if num * k >= p:
            k = p - k
        if num != k and num % k == 0:
            break

If someone were to walk around the world, it would require a total of approximately 79,030 miles (127,380 km). The world measures about 24,900 miles across the equator. To walk around the world, you would have to walk without stopping for 795 days straight.
No, walking is not generally known as an extremely fast method, though it is one of the fastest methods of exercise for the body.
An average human adult can walk between 60–70 km (approximately 32–44 miles) per day, excluding stops, which implies a speed of approximately 3–5 km/h (2–3 mph). If you want to start walking for fitness, 2.5 hours of daily walking would be ideal.
Overall, walking is a healthy way to move around. You must take daily walks to build your endurance, and walking is an excellent way to maintain a healthy lifestyle, stay out of trouble with your legs, and lower your risk of many health issues, like diabetes or heart disease.

instruction: Pretend to be a business professional. Act like you are giving your mentee professional advice on the most essential points to create a self-sustaining business within the next five years time without the help of external investors.
output:
Pretend to be a business professional. Act like you are giving your mentee professional advice on the most essential points to create a self-sustaining business within the next five years time without the help of external investors.
Be patient and make sure you get an understanding of the business perspective of your mentee by explaining your past experiences, as well as the steps they need to take to achieve their goals.
Your interaction must be professional and constructive, as any failure to do so may result in damage to the relationship.
A business mentoring program focuses on the following areas:
Sales and branding
Accounting and administration
Marketing and brand development
Human relationships and conflict management
Team motivation, mentoring and mentoring development
These areas provide the focus for any mentor-mentee relationship, and are essential for the success of a mentoring program.
A significant aspect of business mentoring is establishing a trusting relationship between the mentor and mentee. To forge a bond with a mentee, you will need to know your mentee’s business well, as well as their personality and interests, such as travel, hobbies, and interests.
Knowing these elements, you can understand their strengths and weaknesses, and tailor the mentoring program to support their progress. The following are some tips on how to establish a trusting relationship in a business mentoring program:
Make time to spend with your mentee; this can be done outside of work hours or through lunch discussions.
Talk with your mentee, build trust by sharing your experiences openly, listen carefully, and take the time to acknowledge and acknowledge their thoughts.
Be respectful of your mentee and their thoughts to build a positive and constructive trust relationship.
Be patient and understanding; it’s crucial to know that establishing a relationship takes time.
Maintain confidentiality and follow the necessary ethical guidelines when involving your mentee or sharing insights from others.
Be sure to keep the lines of communication open, and if there is any issue, talk openly within the framework of the relationship.
When a mentoring relationship reaches its end, a mentee can leave a feeling of disappointment, since they may not have achieved all they could have. However, ending a mentoring relationship is not easy; it brings with it challenges ranging from a sense of loss, the end of a useful relationship, and confusion over the goal, among others.
Here are seven steps to help your mentee end a business mentoring relationship in a smooth and constructive way:
Acknowledge the difficulties
Understand how the mentee feels and acknowledge that it's a common feeling to have when a mentoring relationship ends.
Ask the mentee how they feel, and be aware of their feelings
Emphasize how grateful you are for having them in your life
Let the mentee express their thoughts about the mentoring relationship
Be a sounding board by listening attentively, encouraging them, and acknowledging how tough it is to leave a mentoring relationship
Remember that one of the reasons for ending the mentoring relationship was to move on, and make sure you express your support in this
Offer the benefit of constructive criticism or suggestions about how to carry on without a mentor, this is a great way of giving respect while keeping the mentoring relationship as constructive and professional as it should be
Acknowledge that the mentoring relationship was helpful, but it's time to move on
Offer to stay in touch and express how much you will miss them as a mentor, you can be sure that you will both remain friends and can still share experiences if you like
It is vital to emphasize that ending a mentoring relationship in a professional and friendly manner requires more thinking, compassion, and tactfulness.
While many people can benefit from business mentoring programs, it’s vital to make them effective and productive. However, establishing and maintaining a mentoring program requires patience, dedication, and a supportive attitude. You must show empathy for your mentee to help them succeed and not get discouraged because of challenging circumstances.
A business mentoring program can help you build meaningful relationships with like-minded individuals, and it's vital to keep in touch and continue to develop your business even after the official mentoring period.

instruction: If I found a dollar bill, would it be illegal to keep it ?
output:
If I found a dollar bill, would it be illegal to keep it ? 
Yes!

(a) To whom can one give a dollar bill?
(b) What if the dollar bill fell into a lake?
(c) If one found a dollar bill in a grocery store, would the grocery store allow one to keep it?
Yes, a store would not want to look like they are profiting off of a dollar bill!
(d) Is it illegal to use a dollar bill instead of a dollar from a coin counter?
No, dollar bills and coins are equivalent to one another in value!

If I give a dollar to someone to buy something, would it be legal or illegal? 
Legal!
(a) Can I earn one dollar by doing some work for the store?
Yes if you are allowed to serve the customers and collect money. It depends on the store
(b) Can one get a free coffee from a store and exchange the dollar bill for the coffee?
No! That is an illegal exchange!
(c) What happens if we found a dollar bill in a public place like the beach or a building?
That would be called stray dollar bill and you may not keep it unless you are a police officer!
If I found a bank robber's money, can I keep it?
No! Unless the bank robber lets you keep it!

instruction: Suppose I have 12 eggs. I drop 2 and eat 5. How many eggs do I have left?

#

The problem solving technique known as Elimination by Exclusion (EBE) is an effective way to arrive at a solution by systematically and logically eliminating all the possibilities that don't match the desired outcome.

EBE is a process that involves eliminating all the possible options that can't be the answer. You start with the maximum amount of answers (for example, the number of people in a room, or a total sum of money) and start eliminating the smaller options until you get down to only one possible answer. Let's illustrate a simple instance of EBE: What age is the second kid?

## Step 1

Think of two possible answers.

The first answer, child #1.

The second answer, child #2.

## Step 2

Eliminate the first answer, child #1.

Child #1 is 5. Child #2 can't be older than child #1, so he can't be 5. You must now eliminate all options that are older than 5. So, you can't be 6, 7, or 8.

## Step 3

Eliminate the second answer, child #2.

Child #2 is 10. Child #1 can't be younger than child #2, so he can't be 10. You must eliminate all other age groups from 11 to 14.

## Step 5

Now, the only answer that is left is child #2, age 8.

EBE is useful on two counts. First, the technique is logical and can lead to the correct outcome. Second, the technique ensures you've thought through all possibilities. This is important because we often don't understand why we make the decision we make. By keeping track of the possible outcomes you eliminated, you can discover and correct errors that may have crept in.

Let's use another example to illustrate using EBE: What is the value of N?

## Step 1

Let A be the number of people in a room and let B be the number of apples available. Let C be the maximum number of apples that people in the room can eat.

The answer to the original problem is N - (A x B × C) = N - (A x C), which means N is equal to (A x C) minus what people eat out of the apples.

## Step 2

Eliminate All Possible Outcome.

We can eliminate the maximum number of people in the room (that's A) because it's impossible. We can also eliminate the maximum number of apples that people can eat because people can only eat as many apples as they can pack away.

## Step 3

Eliminate the Possible Outcome as N is not equal to A

We have established that people cannot eat more apples than they pack away. So, N must be the number of apples people are able to eat, and they can't eat more than their maximum intake. Because there is not a single reason why N won't equal A, we have left all possibilities to eliminate A from the equation.

## Step 4

Eliminate All Possible Outcome.

We can eliminate all the values that are not smaller than A.

A = 1 to represent a single person,

A = 2 to represent two people,

A = 3 to represent three people... and so on.

## Step 5

Eliminating All Possible Outcome and get the answer.

We have shown that the value of A is 3, and N, which can be

instruction: Explain why landlords can be considered superior to their tenants
output:
Explain why landlords can be considered superior to their tenants in terms of rights and legal duties.
Some tenants believe that landlords are better than their tenants. So, if you are a tenant trying to figure out the difference, then here are several reasons why landlords are superior, and why it’s best for you to know the legal rights of your landlord and understand your responsibilities.
A landlord might be better than a tenant in many ways, and it’s not just because they own the apartment you’re living in that makes them superior. Here are several ways landlords can be seen as superior:
1. They own the apartment and the property
If you’re a tenant, your lease is considered a contract with the real owner of the apartment. The owner is the person who rents the apartment to you and is responsible for maintaining the property.
A landlord owns the building your apartment is situated in, and they are entitled to make the property a profitable investment. This is why they make sure that your apartment satisfies certain legal guidelines and standards, especially pertaining to safety.
On the other hand, as a tenant, your primary responsibility is taking care of the apartment in the best way possible, so that it will remain safe and structurally stable.
2. The landlord can end your lease
Landlords can end your lease before the contract is up, if they provide you with adequate notice of six months or more. The six months notice period means the landlord is giving you ample time to either look for a new place or to sell or rent the apartment. Your landlord can, therefore, legally terminate your lease without paying you anything extra.
If you go beyond that, the landlord can evict you for non-payment of the lease or other contractual obligations, and it can be a hard procedure to overcome.
A tenant cannot break the lease agreement without receiving permission or paying compensation. When one tenant commits a breach of agreement or lease conditions, it can affect the whole group of tenants occupying the apartment, according to lease agreements.
3. There are legal obligations landlords can take advantage of, so they benefit from the legal system
If a landlord provides you with substandard living condition for the apartment, such as bad repair work, they can use the system to their advantage by suing you or applying for damages. Landlords can sue you for legal reasons pertaining to their legal duties and obligations, and if found guilty, they can get you penalized appropriately.
As a tenant, if you cannot solve the conflicts at hand, you may need to look for legal aid or a landlord-tenant lawyer, especially if the problem is affecting you. Lawsuits, disputes, and legal issues can be overwhelming, and they become more stressful when you know it affects a whole community of tenants.
4. Landlords can be exempt from some of the tenant’s responsibilities
Landlords must satisfy certain legal obligations. A landlord must also take steps to protect the tenant’s legal rights before rent is paid, among such obligations are:
Inspect your property at least once a year
Keep all property safe
Avoid any unreasonable fees or charges
Keep the premises upkeep at the standard required by the law
As a landlord, if you do not adhere to these obligations, you can incur penalties or charges you cannot afford to pay, resulting in legal repercussions, which can harm your reputation or affect your business negatively.
Now that you’ve understood the differences between both landlords and tenants, it’s best to keep your contractual obligations and seek help if you’re in a conflict. If you have any doubts about your obligations, contract terms, and legal rights, seek legal advice through reliable legal advisors.

instruction: The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?
output:
The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?
We recommend installing more access points throughout your home. Or you can also try using an Ethernet cable to link your wireless router to your nearby devices that are experiencing connectivity issues.
I lost the password to my Wi-Fi network.  How can I reset it?
You can find this in the router or access point’s setup menu. Look for the “Reset to factory defaults” section. Your password will be gone and you need to add a new one. If you lost the password, you’re out of luck, and it’s up to you to create a new one.
Do wireless home networks use a different WAN connection?
No, your wireless network will use the same WAN connection as your wired devices. Any device connected to the network uses the same WAN connection, whether it’s a Wi-Fi connected device or a wired device via Ethernet.
Do home Wi-Fi routers have a maximum speed?
If you have a 5 GHz router, it usually supports 867 Mbps. Depending on the router, the 2.4 GHz band has a maximum speed of up to 54 Mbps, and the 5 GHz band has a maximum speed of up to 1.3 Gbps.
Does a Wi-Fi router need power?
Yes. A traditional router uses electricity to send and receive signals. It runs off power, which can be supplied using an AC power adapter or a power strip. If you have a 24-hour Internet requirement, then a battery-operated router will not provide enough energy.
Does my Wi-Fi router support mesh networking?
Generally, a wired router and access points can be used together as a mesh network. But a mesh network uses devices that are connected over Wi-Fi. Some routers, such as the Amazon Eero and the Netgear Orbi, support mesh networking.
Can my Wi-Fi router replace my modem?
Yes, it’s true that a wireless router or access point can also act as a modem. The router acts as the hub to which you plug your devices. The router then acts as a gateway which connects your devices to the Internet. In this case, you can simply ignore the modem, and use your Wi-Fi router as your connection.

instruction: Why can't you see the stars in the city, but you can in the countryside?
output:
Why can't you see the stars in the city, but you can in the countryside? Because there is something special between nature and us. Just like in a relationship, both parties need to play their part, and in that case, you got off to a good start.
Why do you think things sometimes work out that way and sometimes not?
Well, it's important to know that it doesn't just rest on us. It's just a natural relationship process, which may have a beginning and an ending, as there are some factors you cannot control. The other person's personal background, relationship history, life experiences, etc can influence their ability to love us, as much as people's personalities can have an effect on our willingness to love them too.
How can I find love like that?
We have some things to be on our toes when it comes to love. So, it's never too late to start living your life to the fullest, do things you wouldn't normally do, and be open to new opportunities. Go out there, get to know people, make new friends, attend events that you enjoy, and build your self-worth by trying new things, which has an added bonus in that love is really all about attraction, so if you don't like what or who attracts you, then nothing else will do.
And even in life, the best, most genuine love always comes from a personal conviction by each person to do the things, they know in their heart, they need to do — which may involve hard work, compromise, sacrifice, or just pure sacrifice, especially in relationships. But we encourage a lot of trust-building and communication. Communication is indeed the key to building strong, lasting relationships, and it's the same in the case of love too.
Do you think that finding true love is easy?
Finding true love is not an easy task by any mean. It may be challenging and require hard work, patience, faith, and a lot of trust, but once you find that one person that you care about the most, it's worth all the effort you put into making it work. You can learn how to find true love in this article, here.
Now, that's all well and good, but what about true love that could be in an instant?
Yes, there is true love in the blink of an eye, and it happens all the time, even if the circumstances that led to such relationships aren't the most ideal.
How is that possible?
Well, love finds people who are ready to receive it, and sometimes, the reason for why things happen isn't always clear or understood. So a couple may have fallen in love at first sight, but there may be a reason why; one or both of them knew of the other beforehand.
What's the significance of your question?
The significance of this question is that love can happen in an instant. It doesn't wait for anything; it just happens. True love, in most cases, feels like more than just affection or friendship.
True love can be a lightning bolt, when both parties feel an instant attraction to each other, or it could be a slow-brewing passion that happens over years. Either way, to experience that, you need to give it time, but it should feel different, and it should make you feel like nothing can beat it.
What is it like to meet someone that's just "what I wanted in a mate?"
Meeting someone that "just feels right" is like a match that you have been waiting for. When it happens, it feels like the universe has perfectly aligned to bring you together.
It's a feeling that's hard to explain, and once you feel it, you'll know what I'm talking about because you'll feel it in your bones and in your veins. And what's even stranger is that it is often like an instant attraction, which makes it easier to maintain over a long time, especially if it feels right to you and the person you are with.
That's why you know if it's true love, because you know it's in all the right places.
When you meet someone — say, it's a partner — that you just feel that it's meant to be. What happens afterward?
The following are our tips for when you meet your soul mate or the person that you just feel it's meant to be:
Take the time. When you meet someone for the first time, it's essential to take the time to understand each other more and let things evolve organically, because a lot of times what happens isn't necessarily planned. But over time, everything falls into place, and you both learn how to make your relationship work.
Communicate openly. It is essential to understand each other's perspectives, emotions, and feelings, and that includes your hopes,

instruction: Help me get a job in the government in which I’ll have major bargaining power
output:
Help me get a job in the government in which I’ll have major bargaining power”
Well, I have, and I still have, no desire to be involved in politics, and that is because I want to get in, not “work for” government. If government workers wanted to be involved in politics then, just like us common people, you would have to put yourself forward to run for office. (As you know, my personal politics and my views on how best to serve the public differ considerably… so I wouldn’t expect to be elected. But I like to keep those options open. )
I guess I just see little distinction, and probably why I remain apathetic when it comes to government hiring.
But I see the distinction now, and I think that makes me a bit more sympathetic with concerns about the “culture of government” and its potential for abuse of power.
It’s also more about a personal preference for the “American way of life” and how I can most effectively support it rather than getting caught up in the politics of it.
I’m not sure why I get defensive when people complain about it, but it seems to have become a knee-jerk reaction lately.
It’s great to be able to articulate my personal view, however.
And it’s an encouraging reflection that my views and understanding might have developed and grown.
T.M., I agree with what you say here. I’ve come to realize that most Americans in general still hold deep seated respect for the government, and if the government is going to work properly they must work together, cooperate, and communicate effectively. It’s not about winning, it’s about the will of the people and getting things done, no matter who’s in power.
T.M.: The reason I’ve gotten defensive is because it’s like you and others just dismiss the concerns or “lack of understanding” of people who do make mistakes, which actually doesn’t address the issue. What I’m getting at is that the culture of government is the problem; you can’t just fire or demote people who do things wrong because they might not be able to do their job properly or they might feel they don’t have a chance to speak their minds.
To put it simply, if you want to change, you need to address the issue or “culture of government” rather than just blame or attack specific individuals. Otherwise you’ll just see more of the same.
To me, it seems like you’re just complaining without offering any constructive solutions. It’s not about pointing fingers or attacking people, it’s about coming up with solutions that could help fix the problem.
Well, you’re not wrong. It’s an issue that is systemic, encompassing many factors, and it will take time and effort, patience and persistence, to work. But it can be done. That said, there is no doubt that the current climate in Washington is not helping.
On the subject of firing, I believe that when a government worker does something wrong that puts the public’s interest, or safety, at risk, then, it should be fired, regardless of the political climate. However, I also believe that when a government worker is just doing their job and maybe doing it poorly (like an ill-prepared salesforce) it should be brought to the attention of their superior in the way you might do so at Walmart or McDonald’s. In these cases, I think the government employee has every expectation to be heard, no matter what their pay grade.
The government is, by nature, more than just a collection of individuals. The government is a set of ideals and goals that we have as a society. With that in mind, I think that those ideals and goals must be present no matter who comes into government positions.
While it can be difficult to bring the entire system under control, it is necessary for the best of our political climate to succeed. I think that ultimately, this is about our government acting as an individual, a person. Our elected officials represent us, and they must uphold the ideals that we have come to value in our country. It means that their actions can create positive change, just as negatively they can create chaos.
As such, the government needs people with intelligence, honesty, and a willingness to work with others, no matter what the political climate.
I agree, T.M., but it isn’t just government employees. At work, there are often incentives to hold back from speaking up against bad practices because of the potential consequences. That’s how the government culture functions, too.
I think there’s an important difference, though. Government employees often hold a responsibility to provide crucial public services, which in my view, means they should have a higher, more urgent, imperative to speak up if they feel they could be misusing public funds, violating the law, and putting public safety
