It is known that the Three Pines series is quite simple and easy to listen to. The series includes novels that are written by the famous Canadian author, Louise Penny.
Her characters are well-developed. The series’ writing style isn’t too technical or complicated, with the majority of this genre.
2) Nonfiction Narrations
Nonfiction literature narrations, such as A Brief History of Time by Stephen Hawking, An Incomplete Biography of the Author by George Orwell, or Notes of a Native Son by James Baldwin, for a more educational and enjoyable listening experience.
3) Action-Oriented Audios
If you like action and suspense novels like The Hunger Games of Suzanne Collins or The Maze Runner of James Dashner, they are fantastic choices.
4) Detective Stories
If you’re the type of person who tends to enjoy mystery or crime dramas, you may appreciate listening to an audiobook like The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo of Stieg Larsson or The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt.
5) Adventure/Travel Audiobooks
If you’re into adventure, mystery, or historical stories regarding travel, you may want to try audiobooks such as The World is Still Beautiful by Anas Barbeau-Lavalette or The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho.
Suggest Audiobooks for Intermediate Listeners
The Audiobooks In This Category Are The Ones That You May Enjoy If You Have Listened To Audiobooks A Little While.
1) Historical Audiobooks
A historical narrative is a series that consists of fiction and non-fiction narratives that describe events that took place in the past and are worth relating. Historical Audiobooks are for the intermediate listener.
The historical audiobook is written by Neil Gaiman and features the well-known actor and comedian Stephen Fry, as the audiobook narrator. It is narrated by Neil Gaiman as well!
Scent of a Hero: When a man from the present day travels back to the past, his story becomes intertwined with the historical events. The book’s narration by Michael Page can be an excellent option.
The Pillars of the Earth by Ken Follett, A series narrated by John Lee, is a historical fiction series that takes place during the time of the Middle Ages and is worth listening to.
2) Sci-Fi and Fantasy Audiobooks
It contains both science fiction and fantastical novels, which appeals to the intermediate listeners.
The Way of Kings by Brandon Sanderson, it’s a first part of the Cosmere, a series that is more than a decade old narrated by Michael Kramer, and the narration is quite awesome.
The Night Angel Trilogy by Brent Weeks is an intermediate level book that is a fantasy series that is the narrator’s Michael Kramer’s most recent narration.
The Stormlight Archive by Brandon Sanderson, is a science fiction series that is popular among audiobook enthusiasts. It’s known that The Way of Kings audiobook series is available on audiobook services.
3) Memoir Audiobooks
For the intermediate audiobook listener, a great choice is memoirs. These audiobooks are compelling stories because they tell the story of life’s challenging times. It’s narrated by the authors, such as David Sedaris, whose memoirs are among the most beloved.
Tiny Beautiful Things: Advice on Love and Life From Dear Sugar is a nonfiction memoir written by Cheryl Strayed. The audiobook’s narration is narrated by the author.
Becoming by Michelle Obama is a memoir that is narrated by its author, and the book is known for inspiring people worldwide.
The Last Lecture by Randy Pausch is a nonfiction book that is narrated by MacLeod Andrews and is known for teaching valuable life lessons.
4) Biographical Audiobooks
For the more advanced listener, the best biographical audiobooks are ideal.
Tara Westover’s autobiographical audiobooks, Educated, features the narrator Katherine Fuge. It is a story that explores Tara’s life and the difficulties involved.
The Power of Habit, a self-help autobiography by Charles Duhigg, is narrated by the author himself. It’s an excellent choice for a more advanced audiobook listener who enjoys audio-tapes.
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo by A. S. Byatt, is an audiobook available on Audible, narrated by the author, and is known for telling the story of the main character who experiences trauma and violence.
5) The Mysterious Audiobooks
To make the most of listening to mysteries, audiobooks are an excellent choice.

Building a following and engaging audience with vlogging can be a lot of fun and a great way to build brand awareness and recognition.

Find the right microphone and camera.
Write consistent, quality content to share with your audience.

instruction:
You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output:
You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
Your first objective is to acknowledge that the other person feels uncomfortable. Say "Hearing that you need space is important, I can understand how difficult it can be to talk to someone".
Then follow up with "I would love for this to be fun for everyone. Do you feel better if I keep my voice down for a while and let you take over the driving?".
This response acknowledges that when we're all together, it's important to get along, it lets the other person know that their feeling are important and that you want to provide a space for them to do what they want.
Next step is to ask questions to open up the conversation.
You can say. "What kind of stuff do you love when you're alone?" or "Do you have some things you would want to share with me?".
By asking open-ended questions you allow for the other person to reveal something of themselves and you can lead the conversation from there.
It all depends on how much the other person is willing to make their desires known, but these approaches should help. The important thing is to show understanding but also to help them understand that you are open to hearing them out, no matter how uncomfortable you are in the moment.

instruction:
You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.

Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.
output:
You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.

Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.

A group of European football fans from all nations and backgrounds have come together to form OneLove FC on social media, organizing tournaments, football matches, charity and solidarity activities.

The OneLove campaign has been opposed by several football federations and some politicians over the last year, and the initiative’s founder and former Dutch international player, Dennis Bergkamp, has been questioned by some media outlets over his involvement in the campaign. The campaign’s most visible symbol is a rainbow, or “OneLove” armband, which players will wear while performing a gesture of peace.

The campaign has drawn criticism that it ignores the need for specific discrimination policies and that it places the onus of overcoming discrimination on individuals rather than institutions.

The OneLove initiative stands for:

* Equal opportunities for all
* Social and cultural diversity
* Respects for one another – players, coaches and spectators
* Equality should be the rule rather than an exception

Create a story of how the OneLove campaign affected the world of football and European politics in the last two years.

**Answers**

1. A story should begin with the creation of the OneLove campaign, detailing the reasons behind its launch. The story will then continue, describing the activities of the group, as well as players who have chosen to wear the armband.

2. The OneLove FC group will create a social media campaign to raise awareness for the campaign’s launch and get a large audience to support the initiative. The group will also organize sports tournaments and charity activities to raise funds and spread more awareness. It remains to be seen whether these activities will be taken up by other European football leagues or fan groups.

3. The story next moves to the football authorities and governments who oppose the campaign. Some politicians and administrators argue against the campaign because they believe that by focusing on the “one love” slogan, the initiative is ignoring the need for specific policies against discrimination. But the OneLove campaign argues that equality should be the rule rather than the exception.

4. The story continues to describe how the campaign has affected other European football leagues in different ways: some are strongly against it, some have a positive stance, some have yet to make a decision. Some even support the idea of a OneLove campaign, but without the armbands.

5. The OneLove campaign is not only aimed at football players, but involves the whole European football and politics scene. Therefore, the story describes the reactions of soccer fans and politicians alike. Fans of different nationalities and politicians of different parties react to the initiative and support the fight for equality. The story describes a mixed reaction, with some fans agreeing with the idea and others protesting about the campaign’s impact on national culture.

6. The final chapter of the story describes the outcome of the campaign. The EU and other political organizations adopt the initiative and start making laws against discrimination to ensure that football fans and players everywhere enjoy the full potential of the game. 

We hope that you found these sample scenarios helpful in planning your writing. Good luck!

# Sentiment Analysis

Sentiment analysis is a specific type of machine learning that looks at the sentiment (positive, negative, neutral) of the words in a given text. Sentiment analysis is used to help in many types of business applications, such as customer reviews, social media monitoring, product/feature reviews, or news headlines. Sentiment analysis has also found application in the understanding of sentiment and attitude in legal and financial analysis.

## Questions

output:

Name: Jane

- Architect
- Interested in Tech
Written in first person
Use casual tone
A sentence that explains their career, passion or other interests for their Twitter bio.

38 characters: Jane @JaneArchitect interested in Tech

Example 2: #Art
Name: Bob
Main points:
- Artist
- Has new work available for sale
- Has an exhibition coming up
Written in first person
Use formal tone
A sentence that summarizes their career, the exhibition they’re promoting and why they’re a good person to follow!

46 characters: Bob @Bobartist Artwork available #ArtExhibit 2 weeks from now


**Example 3.** #Tech

Name: John
Main points:
- Tech entrepreneur
- Passionate about cybersecurity
- Has a new book coming out, check out!
Written in first person
Use formal tone

instruction:
A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output:
A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
Ability to take initiative, work independently, and prioritize work without supervision.
How to Create a Job Description?
Writing a job description might look simple, but it is a challenging task that required attention to details. First, you need to conduct a thorough job analysis, understand how the specific role will fit in the organization, and analyze existing job descriptions from competitors and other software engineering positions. After this process, you can move on to creating a job description that provides detailed job information in an easily understandable format.

1. Start with a Job Title
First things first, start your job description with a clear and catchy job title. It should be descriptive, and it should catch the attention of potential candidates.

2. Briefly explain the Job
Briefly explain the job to the readers, which includes a brief insight into the job, the purpose, aims, and objective of the job role from the company's perspective.

3. Job Requirements
The job responsibilities give a list of the minimum required criteria for candidates to apply, which includes skills, qualification, training or experience; be it knowledge on any particular languages, technologies, or certifications.

4. Job Requirements

In most job descriptions, it is common to state specific requirements and experience in a range of categories such as work experience, educational criteria, and certifications. Job requirements can be categorized into the following:
Qualifications/Education
Experience
Certifications/ Licensing
Technical Skills
Communication & Collaboration
The list of job requirements can help the potential candidates to decide if they fulfill the requirements.

5. The job description should include a description of the position and the qualifications that need to be fulfilled for consideration of the job. It should also contain a clear description of the day-to-day activities for the role.

6. Working Environment
A job description should describe what specific workplace requirements, such as office hours, environment, and availability, the company wants from its employees.

7. Work Schedule and Benefits
Provide information on work schedule, vacation policies, and holidays as part of your job description. Include information about the company benefits, such as pay rates, health insurance, retirement plans, and other benefits.

8. Application Requirements
End your job description with the application process and the required documents for the application such as cover letters, resume or linkedin

Writing About Skills & Experience
A job requirement and experience section is one of the critical parts of the job description that describes what a candidate expects. Here is an example:

What software tools and expertise should he/she perform the job role using?

What certifications or experience that can bring to the position?

What certifications or experience that can bring to the position?

Examples include:
Experience with various programming languages, such as Python, Java, Ruby on Rails.
Have experience with major database and storage systems like SQL, MySQL.
Have expertise in data science techniques such as machine learning , data mining.
Have experience using cloud systems, such as AWS or Azure, to develop and deploy large scale data systems.
Experience with open source frameworks and software applications such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, Tableau, PowerBI.
Hands-on experience with web or mobile applications development frameworks such as Django, Flask.
Skills that can bring to the job position can be included as a list or a bulleted format.

Avoid Overloading with Too Many Details
No matter how much you need to convey about what the candidate would be doing, it's never a good idea to overwhelm the candidate by listing too many details

instruction:
Considering the reason for the rejection, write a polite rejection letter for rejecting a candidate.

Reason: You came in second
output:
Considering the reason for the rejection, write a polite rejection letter for rejecting a candidate.

Reason: You came in second in the interview and I've already offered the position to Sarah Smith who came in first. Thank you for applying, but she is much more qualified than you and I'm sure you will find other opportunities.

| 2 | |  |

I'm sorry to hear that you did not get the job. You were chosen due to other reasons but we can only offer one position. I know this can be disappointing, and I wish you the best of luck finding other positions.

Reason: There were some concerns about your background that didn't sit well during the interview. We thank you for applying but we could not see you being a good fit for the position.

| 3 | |  |

I'm excited to offer you the position. Please accept the offer and we will send you the contract details and requirements.

Reason: The job and pay scale are more than what we could offer; however, I hope you have a fulfilling career. If you'll take a few minutes to review the terms of the offer, I'd be happy to answer any questions or clear any doubts.

| 4 | |  |

I'm so excited to have received your application and offer you the job. But, I have a few concerns about your performance during the interview. If you do not understand something, I'm more than happy to answer queries and clear doubts. In this regard, please call me on **phone number**.

Reason: I had to reconsider your application because we've found it tough to find someone with your required skills set. However, please know we value your application and feel confident about recommending you for other positions.

# 14. Writing a Cover Letter

A cover letter can provide the first impression of your application and a good cover letter can give you an edge in a competitive job market. The cover letter is your way to state what you can offer to the candidate.

The cover letter should express your interest about the position and your relevant skills, experience, and education to make you a potential candidate for that position.

The ideal length for the cover letter is around one to two pages and should be 12-point Times New Roman font. The letters should be in the present tense or be written in the informal tone. The letter should be easy to read and highlight the benefits the recipient can offer.

Write a letter that is professional, concise, and persuasive. A clear communication is very important for a good impression. The cover letter should offer a genuine interest in working with the company and match its values or align with its culture. The cover letter should highlight the unique qualities that make the candidate a superior candidate.

The letter can highlight and demonstrate your relevant skills and experience, as well as your educational qualifications. While you should tailor this letter to fit the position you are applying for, make sure you also use this letter as an opportunity to highlight relevant skills, experience, education, and knowledge that matches those required for the position.

If you are applying for an internship, highlight your skills and experience to set you apart and make you a prospective candidate.

The following is a template of a cover letter that you can use as a guide:

**Company Name**

**Postal Address**

**Phone Number**

**Email Address**

**Company Name**

**[Position name]**

**[Date (or soonest)]**

Dear [manager],

My name is [Your name] and I have come across your website and noticed you are looking for a [Position name]. My skillset, experience, education, and knowledge will provide value to your company, and I wish to work for your good cause.

[Skills/Experience/Education for the position name]:

[Insert your relevant skills, experience, and education for the position name here]

[Here, you should summarize the skills you've possessed, relevant knowledge or experience to the best interest of the company].

Thank you for your time in reviewing this letter, and I look forward to working with you to achieve our joint goals.

Regards,

____________________________________________________________________

# 15. Applying for Work Visa from Canada

If you are applying for a job that requires you from outside Canada, applying for a work visa is crucial for you. There are several work permits in Canada, including:

  * Temporary Work Permit
  * Temporary Foreign Worker and Intra-Company Transfer Program
  * International Graduate Program
  * International Cooperating Research Unions Program
  * Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)

There are several factors that you need to address when applying for work visas

output:
We've already decided on the title and topic for our blog post. I would appreciate it if you wrote an introduction paragraph to attract the readers' attention.

Blog title: Healthy Apple Muffins
Blog Topic: recipe and tips for cooking a good apple muffin recipe

Thank you in advance for your work.

--Vikki

Dear Vikki,

Thank you for your trust. Let me provide a clear and concise introduction paragraph to attract readers’ attention.

What’s the importance of healthy muffins or health-friendly foods? As we continue to increase our awareness of eating healthy, it is important that we learn ways to cook and enjoy delicious food in a healthy way. Healthy muffins offer a quick way of getting in needed nutrients as well as being part of a balanced diet that will keep you on track with your health goals. They can be eaten for breakfast, as a healthy snack or dessert. You can make them with different types of fruits like apples, berries, and bananas.

Healthy Apple Muffins is my topic. It can be fun and healthy for you to make a recipe that looks appealing and full of nutrition. instruction:
Design an outline for a blog post based on the given information and list the sections accordingly.

This blog post is going to about making a list of last-minute gift ideas. Also, the tone of the post is going to be relaxed and casual.
output:
Design an outline for a blog post based on the given information and list the sections accordingly.

This blog post is going to about making a list of last-minute gift ideas. Also, the tone of the post is going to be relaxed and casual. 

**Title:** Last Minute Gift Ideas
**Tags:** Holiday, Gifts, Last Minute Gift Ideas

**Introduction:** Everyone knows the feeling by now. People are hurrying around to try and meet deadlines, buy gifts, write thank you cards to the people in their lives. It can be overwhelming. But it’s not all bad. 

By providing a list of last-minute gift ideas, we’re trying to make people’s holidays a little bit easier and enjoyable. 

In today’s post, we’re going to take a look at some great ideas for gifts that can be purchased with no more than a bit of effort. In fact, some may not even take any more effort than what it would take to make or find a gift-wrapped bag and a bow.

**Prose/Paragraph 1:** Everyone has their favorite things, and what one person loves is most likely not the same thing that person loves. So the best gift in my opinion is a gift card that they can use to buy what they want most since it doesn’t take you any time to purchase a gift card. 

**Body Paragraph 1 (Suggested Ideas)**
I am going to list down some suggestion ideas which we can do:
     * Buy a cute planner which can be personalized with stickers and pens that the user can use every day. 
     * Consider gifting an e-book or audiobook of the recipient's favorite author. It's an awesome idea, and people can just read or listen to it all by themselves within their own comfort. 
     * You can take a chance and make a surprise delivery with a couple of fresh flowers from the local florist at the last minute. 

**Prose/Paragraph 2:** Now, moving to another example. There is the option of gifting small and little necessities that they can use every day which can also be good. 

     * Coffee subscription that they will receive monthly from their favorite coffee shop. 
     * A set of stylishly designed kitchen essentials such as a cutting board, spatula, and a molds for the perfect cup or coffee. 
     * Personalized book marks can be a thoughtful and personalized gift if they read a lot. 
    
**Body Paragraph 2 (Suggested Ideas)**
    
I suggest these few additional gifting ideas since it’s possible to buy these at their last moment of gift-giving:
    
     * For those who like to paint or make projects, you can give them some paint supplies or a canvas, a journal or a drawing board. 
     * Think about giving a unique and thoughtful gift such as a candle for those they love, a tea set for a tea connoisseur, or jewelry that they would like. 

**Prose/Paragraph 3:** By the end of it, I hope everyone is clear that giving a thoughtful present with quality can work magic, regardless of whether we give anything expensive or not. If you’re willing to put some effort in thinking to gift something that matches your recipient's tastes and needs, then you are guaranteed to make them feel very appreciated.

**Conclusion:** In this blog, I have shown the possible ideas that we can do for shopping and giving gifts in a short time before the deadline. However, we can add and remove things as it is necessary, depending on the taste and preference of the recipient. So, it’s completely up to the giver if you want to make last-minute gifts with a thoughtful touch.

Section Title: Trusty Jeans
Main point of the section: jeans can be worn all year and look good with everything . . .
																																																																																																																																																														
# Introduction																																																																																																							
Fall is a great time for getting style and dressing up but staying warm at the same time. Jeans come in handy as they work for any occasion. In today's blog piece, a section is dedicated to the importance of this staple and all the reasons why it can be trusted with fashion in mind.

Before delving into the reasons, let's start with looking at the history of the denim-style trouser.
- From its name, "denim", we know that denim pants are made from denim fabric, which is a blue-colored cotton or linen blend. The fabric comes from the name "Damast", which is an Old Persian word for "cloth"
- The modern-day jeans were developed in the nineteenth century in Nuremburg, Germany.
- In the early 1900s (World War I era), there was a demand for work clothes that could resist dirt, oil, and other industrial substances. The denim fabric that was developed in the 140s came in handy as it was resistant to many things of wear and tear.
- In the 1930s, Levi Strauss and his partner, Jacob Davis, developed the now-famous blue jeans, also known as Levi's jeans, by inserting metal rivets into the jeans legs and pockets. They brought it to America, where it was a sensation at the time for workwear.
- After World War II, jeans became a popular fashion statement throughout America.

And so, for over a century, denim has held an unquestionable position as one of the most significant fashion trends in clothing history. The versatile, durable, and casual style of jeans has kept them fashionable and appealing.

## Trusty Jeans are the First Choice for Any Occasion

From daytime casual to evening formal, jeans are the first choice for dressing up or dressing down and can complement your style in any way.

A few occasions you might find yourself dressing up in denim clothes-
																																																																							
	- Date night or a night out with a friend

	- Office workday or formal business dressing

																																																																						
	- Weekend getaways, festivals, or travel, where jeans are comfortable, rugged, and easy to dress up.

Jeans have a timeless appeal and can be dressed up or down to suit every day situations. The comfort and ease of jeans make it possible to dress to impress, no worries.

## Jeans are Incredibly Versatile

Jeans give an incredible amount of versatility and freedom in terms of outfit combinations- they match almost anything. Jeans have become more than an item of

instruction:
Create a detailed caption for an Instagram post about a discount. A proper caption should explain the product, offer the discount, and tell the user how to claim it.

Product: Golang course
Product description: teaching the foundational skills for building cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development
Discount: 50%
How to claim: Use the coupon code: GOLANG
output:
Create a detailed caption for an Instagram post about a discount. A proper caption should explain the product, offer the discount, and tell the user how to claim it.

Product: Golang course
Product description: teaching the foundational skills for building cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development
Discount: 50%
How to claim: Use the coupon code: GOLANG10_2021 when registering for the course.

Here’s an excerpt from a good caption:

With this course you will acquire an in-depth understanding of the Golang ecosystem.

– Learn how to develop web services with simple, safe, and fast code.
– You will walk away from this course with the foundational skills for designing high-speed, low-latency, and highly available cloud applications.
– Learn to work with the latest tools and technologies, such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Prometheus.

– Discount details: Use the coupon code [GOLANG10_2021] to get the discount on the course.
– Available until the [19th of December, 2021].

When you offer a promo code or a discount code, include it in your caption. This will ensure that the audience knows how to get the discount on time.

When writing a caption, try to create a conversational tone to make it more engaging. Start by telling the user what’s covered in the course. Next, describe the nature of Golang, what the course teaches, and how the user will get the discount. A proper caption will compel more users to click on the post and claim the discount.

4. Use high-quality pictures to improve your Instagram posts.

Instagram is a visual platform, so your posts should have a visual appeal. Use high-quality images to captivate your audience’s attention. High-quality images will drive clicks, engagement, comment and even share. You can get free stock images or use premium, high-quality paid stock photos from websites like Unsplash, Pexels, and Pixabay. Another way to achieve this is to use an Instagram editor, such as Canva, to make the photos look professional.

There’s nothing as powerful as high-quality images, especially on Instagram. You can use creative photos to attract a larger audience for your discount promo.

5. Schedule your Instagram posts during the preferred time for your target demographic.

Instagram posts that capture the user’s time are crucial. Every person is active on the platform at various times. As a result, understanding the time people use Instagram will help you.

Post and schedule on the days your target audience is most active on Instagram. You can use the Instagram insights tool, which provides information on your followers, interactions, and engagement metrics. It will uncover the preferred time for your target demographic.

Scheduling a post on the right time can help improve your engagement rate as it aligns to the users’ activity on the platform. Here’s a typical schedule on Instagram:

Sunday - Monday 5 am to 8 pm - Post during these hours could generate high engagement
Monday - Tuesday 10 pm to 4 am - Post during these hours could generate high engagement
Tuesday - Wednesday 9 am to 5 pm - Post during these hours could generate high engagement
Thursday and Friday 5 pm to 11 pm - Post during these hours could generate high engagement

Every individual has their favorite time to use Instagram, but there are times when Instagram is more active than others. Knowing the time of your target demographic will help you schedule your posts at the most receptive time.

6. Repeat your discount deals to increase its reach on Instagram.

Repeat your discount deal on Instagram at regular intervals for more engagement and clicks. When you offer a discount deal, it will get everyone excited. However, you don’t want the excitement to fade too soon. By repeating the same content and discount deal, there’s a chance to engage more users throughout the lifecycle.

With high-quality visuals, a concise caption, and proper time scheduling, you can generate more engagement and leads through your Instagram posts. However, to maximize the results, repeat the offer to increase its reach on Instagram and encourage more followers to click.

7. Add a call-to-action post-button.

Your post should include a CTA (call-to-action) button to direct the audience to where the discount code is applied to the post. Adding a CTAs button will enable the user to take the desired action. A CTA button can be a “Shop Now,” “Claim Your Deal,” or "Get Started" button. Adding a CTA button will inform the user of the desired action to take or where they can find more

instruction:
You are given a topic for an Instagram post. Help the post reach a broader audience by suggesting hashtags related to the post.

Another episode of women in science is out now
output:
You are given a topic for an Instagram post. Help the post reach a broader audience by suggesting hashtags related to the post.

Another episode of women in science is out now on my YouTube channel. It's focused on the science behind human reproduction and how female bodies are uniquely programmed for reproduction while maintaining bodily integrity. The episode starts out focusing on how the female reproductive system works and moves on to the process of egg storage, how a female body is programmed for pregnancy, and why the female body maintains that program even after the embryo is transferred to the uterus. Finally, the episode wraps up with a discussion about the many ways in which modern reproduction is complicated including by artificial insemination, donor sperm, embryo disposal, and surrogacy.

For more details, watch this season's first two episodes on women in science (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5tN6995_19g&t=828s, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4j5gTqL8FvM&t=1s). Additionally, you can sign up to my newsletter on my website (https://jessiehoupengay.com) to receive early access to my new episode and episode notes.

### What are your thoughts on current events such as COVID-19, climate change, or racial justice?

COVID-19 continues to have a significant impact on everyone globally. The scientific community has contributed a great deal of information to the public about the pandemic, how COVID-19 spreads and how it affects the body. As an educator, I am using this time to offer more online resources and to create a more dynamic, engaging approach to STEM education.

Climate change continues to be an essential topic, though it gets a lot less attention than it deserves, especially due to the political climate where certain entities are trying to downplay the urgency of the issue. I believe that climate change will be one of the defining issues of our generation, so it is important for me to continuously contribute to its importance for younger generations.

Racial justice and inequality continue to make headlines globally — there are many issues to address. But there are two that immediately come to mind when confronted with the complexities:

  1. Addressing systemic racism, inequality, and social justice
  2. Combating climate change — particularly for marginalized groups.

I believe that both of these issues are complex and that I need to approach them with humility, empathy and an ongoing need for education.

I encourage you (and everyone) to find a way to participate in these conversations, as they are important, and I wish there were fewer voices speaking in echo chambers and more that share their perspectives.

## 7. RESPONSIBLE SCIENCE EDUCATION AND NARRATIVE

Science education, and the way we teach the science we know about and the subjects we study, plays an essential role in forming how our society and culture perceive the world. This affects decision-making and policy-making at different levels. In the 21st century, science education has to respond to the demand for a more inclusive and socially responsible approach to teaching STEM subjects than has usually been the case.

So far in the 21st century, we have witnessed huge progress in social inclusivity, but our progress so far hasn't been enough to address all of the inequalities, injustices, and discrimination that have plagued our society. In this chapter, we will look at how science education can play a bigger role in promoting socially responsible development and, in doing so, encourage and empower children and youth to actively engage with complex subject matters related to scientific and environmental research.

This chapter focuses on the relationship between scientific research, scientific education, and ethical issues in the teaching of science, which needs to be addressed in more detail to create an awareness and engagement from individuals to the society.

There has become an urgent demand of science educators in recent times to promote socially responsible development, which is necessary, as there is an increasing demand for the science community to contribute to the societal development. As science education is central in promoting the sciences, as well as its societal application, developing socially responsible scientific education and scientific research is essential.

### Responsibly Responsible Science Education:

Responsible science education is critical to producing responsible scientists, including scientists who are not only capable of understanding research processes but also are well-equipped to contribute to the development of their communities. That is why responsible science education, both at national level and university level, is a necessity.

Moreover, responsible science education is imperative in ensuring ethical engagement in scientific research or exploration. For instance, responsible science education promotes the use of ethical decision-making in scientific research, such as ensuring its benefits outweigh the negative effects on communities, the environment, and other people. Responsible science education should also promote environmental conservation

instruction:
The topic of a YouTube post has been described and based on the information, you need to write a hook for starting the post. A catchy hook will keep your readers interested so they keep reading. It would be great if you could come up with as many hooks as you can.

A video showing how to make a tasty cup of coffee
output:
The topic of a YouTube post has been described and based on the information, you need to write a hook for starting the post. A catchy hook will keep your readers interested so they keep reading. It would be great if you could come up with as many hooks as you can.

A video showing how to make a tasty cup of coffee might have the following start:

  * [Title] How to brew amazing coffee drinks at home in three simple steps
  * [Subtitle] Using an eureka 107 coffee maker
  * [Hook] Have you ever tasted a coffee that made you go "Wow, what is that?"
  * [Body] My name is Lisa, and I am a coffee connoisseur, and this is one of the simple and best ways to brew amazing coffee
  * [Link] Visit my website http://www.lisasnugg.com.

How do you explain the use of a hook?

A hook is a sentence, line or a phrase used to grab your reader's attention. It could be anything – something funny or thought-provoking that will make the reader eager to know anything more about the topic.

A catchy hook can help get your blog or video audience's attention immediately. You want them to click on it, and read or watch your post. Think of a joke, funny anecdote, or an informative fact, or think of something that catches the reader's eye.

For example, a video about the benefits of morning walks for fitness enthusiasts could have a hook such as:

#### Hook:

"A brisk walk on a Sunday morning could make a big difference to your health!"

So, a video about getting up early and taking a brisk morning walk could get our attention right from the start and make us wonder how it could impact our health.

Write several hooks for different video topics, and see which one works the best.

In conclusion, how would you describe a hook?

A hook is a sentence, line or a phrase used to grab our attention. It could be anything – a funny anecdote, or a thought-provoking fact or line – that makes the reader curious and interested. Using a catchy hook can draw people's attention to your blog or YouTube channel and make them want to click and read more, leading to higher engagement and conversions.

# Chapters 10-12

Now that we have gotten an overview of the writing and blogging process along with the main tips and strategies required to write a successful book or blog, it's time to delve into each of the chapters in more detail.

# Chapter 10 - How to Choose Your Niche in Blogging

Blogging is easier than ever. Anyone can start a blog and have it up and running in a week or two. If your blog's niche or topic is relevant and interesting, you might attract thousands of readers and eventually turn that into a successful income.

But, deciding on a blogging niche was a challenge many bloggers encountered early but it shouldn't be to you if you're reading this content. In this chapter, I'll be explaining how to choose a niche in blogging, what niche will work for you, and the process you will follow to select your niche in blogging.

## What do you need to know about a niche in blogging?

A niche in blogging refers to the subject area the blog writer deals with under a particular field.

A niche in blogging is an attractive subject matter that you have a lot of knowledge or enthusiasm in, and you want to write and share with others. A common but important question many bloggers ask is what niche should they stick to?

It's crucial selecting a niche that you can maintain because once you select a niche, it could determine how your blog or YouTube channel will look like.

Having a niche blog allows your target audience to easily find your content, and it shows they're interested in what you write about. It can make you stand out from the rest in a competitive market.

You can start with a particular niche, and your blog or YouTube channel can expand as you become familiar with it.

That's not to say that you can't expand your target audience by moving into new topics after you have established yourself within that niche.

## Tips for choosing a niche in blogging

Before you decide on what niche to choose for your blog or YouTube channel, here are a few things to consider:

### 1. Determine Your Passion

Determine your niche in blogging when you focus on your interests and passions. It helps to connect with your unique audience whose interests align with your interests. It also establishes the brand and message you represent.

### 2. Select a Niche That has High Demand

Check what people are looking for and the

Remember to keep your video titles and descriptions brief & clear, but powerful enough to capture the attention of viewers. Make sure you choose headlines which are specific and relevant to the video's content.

instruction:
Choosing a name for your product or business YouTube channel is an important part of the process. Based on the description of the product or business, you should come up with some interesting names. Take some time to brainstorm your ideas.

Here you will find videos and content that will help students prepare for the application process to graduate schools as well as how to apply to graduate schools
output:
Choosing a name for your product or business YouTube channel is an important part of the process. Based on the description of the product or business, you should come up with some interesting names. Take some time to brainstorm your ideas.

Here you will find videos and content that will help students prepare for the application process to graduate schools as well as how to apply to graduate schools, how to select a graduate program, and how to give great personal statements for the school essay.

You want your products or services to have a name that makes them sound interesting, unique, and easy to remember. To develop an interesting name, here are some things to think about:

Identify Your Target Audience: Think about the name that would be attractive to your target audience.

Establish Your Brand Identity: Consider the name that will establish your brand identity on YouTube and make it easy for viewers to find. For example, if your brand name is associated with creativity or art, you should come up with a unique name that will help your brand stand out in YouTube.

Keep It Memorable: Remember to pick a name that will be easy for viewers to remember. You would want to stand out among all other YouTube channels or your competitors.

Keep It Professional: Remember to select a name that is professional enough to make your brand seem credible to your audience. A name that is too informal might not be a good fit for your business or your products.

Be Creative: Don't get so serious that you end up choosing an uninspiring name that doesn't fit the brand. Try to come up with an interesting, memorable, and creative name that will leave a lasting impression on viewers.

1. Make a List: Make a list of possible names for your YouTube channel, using your target audience and the content created on the channel as the basis of the name.

2. Find Interesting Names: If you can't come up with an interesting name, you may choose a list of the most popular YouTube channels' names and compare them to see if it makes a good name.

3. Avoid Common Words: Avoid any common words or phrases as it might be overwhelming the audience. It is advisable to come up with your name to show your uniqueness and set yourself apart from your competitors.

4. Check the Domain Availability: After you have developed your name, go to Google, and check if it is still available as a domain name.

You may choose a name that can easily describe what you do, and then add your brand on it.

A great brand name is unique, memorable, and easy to understand. For instance, when people hear or see the name Nescafe, they immediately know that they are about to have a great tasting coffee drink. You can come up with a name by analyzing your target audience, the product you are about to present on YouTube and how it can help the audience. The name should be short, easy to remember, and catchy.

  5. The Name Is the Face/Brand Of Your Channel
  6. If possible, come up with a unique name or combination of words that is short, easy to pronounce, and easy to remember
    1. Check the name's availability on Youtube and Google's search engine
  7. Remember that your name should be a reflection of your brand name, product or service that you are going to present on YouTube

With that being said, when people hear or see your brand name on your YouTube channel name, they know exactly what you sell, and the content you will present on your YouTube channel.

#### 6. Your YouTube Channel Description

The YouTube Channel Description is the first thing viewers see when they visit your channel account. The description helps viewers get to know your channel, brand, or business before they make an investment. It is an advantage to make the description unique, informative, and to the point.

The YouTube Channel Description or About section must:

  * Describe what you offer
  * Tell viewers how to access the YouTube channel's features
  * Mention a unique selling point to differentiate between your products or services in the marketplace
  * Tell viewers about what your YouTube channel offers

  * In the same manner, it is advisable to include your contact information and other relevant links in your YouTube channel description to make it easy for customers to reach out to you.

The description on your YouTube channel is your opportunity to share your brand's value and offer something unique to viewers. Here are some tips to consider:

  1. Keep It Short and To The Point
  2. Don't Make It Salesy
  3. Tell Them How They Will Benefit
  4. Add a Call to Action
  5. Use Effective Descriptive Language

Your YouTube channel's About section is your opportunity to capture viewers' attention. Use descriptive and precise language that explains what you offer
