instruction: Can you help me write a formal email to a potential business partner proposing a joint venture?
output:
Can you help me write a formal email to a potential business partner proposing a joint venture? I need a lot of detail to avoid misunderstanding.
We were both surprised and delighted that you mentioned in passing that your company would like to take on an additional project. The project that you referred to is highly interesting, and we have been watching your companys progress over the years with great interest. A joint venture would create tremendous synergies, and we believe that both companies have the potential to benefit greatly from the collaboration. Our goal is to make sure that both companies can work together to develop new and innovative products, expand into new markets, and reduce costs for mutual benefits.
After talking with your colleague, we now have a much clearer understanding of the key challenges of the current project that are preventing your company from continuing the product line. We feel we can help provide technical expertise and experience to develop innovative solutions not only to solve the key challenges but also to help you improve efficiency, maximize production, and lower costs.
In our proposal, we will detail the specific role that our company can play in the joint venture, identify each parts contribution, and review our past business experience when working on similar projects. Also, our proposal will address potential risks, business model, and profitability, among other topics. Our proposal provides more information in a format that you prefer, so that we can offer all possible solutions. We look forward to working with you to create the best solutions.
How do I write a formal email to a potential client to tell them that I cannot meet them?
Dear Mr. Smith,
I understand that we want to meet in person as soon as possible, but unfortunately, I am not available for that time. As I mentioned earlier, the new project I mentioned on that phone call would require a lot of my time right now, as we are in the initial stages of the project.
Although I understand that it is imperative to meet in person, we can still discuss our project proposal by phone, email, or video-conferencing until a suitable date is agreeable between us.
I am here to provide my best assistance to you and your company, so we cannot compromise on the quality of our communication or work. I am sure that through communication, we can come to a solution that is satisfactory to both of us. We can set a new date for your proposal or set up a conference call that is convenient for both parties.
My office staff and I will be happy to discuss details of our proposal and discuss the potential benefits if you have questions or want more details. You can send me an email for further inquiries.
I look forward to hearing from you regarding the new date we can set for our meeting or the conference call we can have to discuss our proposal. Thank you again for considering us over the years and for your time.
Our company is offering an excellent marketing campaign idea that we believe can make a big difference for your company. However, due to the nature of the service we offer, we can only do it jointly as a collaboration. Our proposal is designed to provide value and a long-term partnership that can help your business achieve success while reducing the cost and risk of the campaign. We are always open to suggestions, and we want to build a long-term relationship with you. We are interested in the project that you mentioned when we spoke on the phone. Our proposal provides more information on both our service and the specific details of the project, as well as the benefits of our marketing campaign.
The initial proposal outlines a clear plan, cost-effective options, and potential opportunities for future development. Since you stated that we can discuss the details of the campaign via phone or email, we can arrange a call or a video-conferencing to go through them in detail.
Thank you for considering our proposal, and we look forward to discussing it with you further.
How do I write a formal email to a potential client to tell them that I am interested in their services or product, but ask for further information?
Dear Miss Thompson,
Thank you for the opportunity to learn more about your companys services, and I appreciate your insight on your product.
I am interested in further learning about the service you provide, and I would like to know more about how we can work together. I would also like to further detail our potential project or collaboration on the phone, email or using video conferencing.
It would be great to go over the service and our project in detail and ensure that both the company and my business are fully aware of the potential costs and benefits before working on the project. After studying your proposal, as well as the potential project, I have come to the conclusion that the partnership we could create is highly beneficial to both of us.
We are looking forward to working with you in our company to develop and execute this project, and we would be happy to discuss any of your questions or concerns related to this proposal. This proposal will outline the project scope, cost, benefits, timelines, and work

instruction: Can you help me write a resignation letter to my current employer, while leaving on good terms and expressing gratitude for the opportunities provided?
output:
Can you help me write a resignation letter to my current employer, while leaving on good terms and expressing gratitude for the opportunities provided?
I have been working for [employer name] since [date] and it has been a privilege to work alongside [name(s) of coworkers]. While I am announcing my resignation, I want to make it clear that I am leaving on good terms and express the utmost gratitude for the opportunities and support provided throughout my time there. [Provide some positive examples of support and opportunities provided by the company, i.e. training, project work, leadership development opportunities, etc.]
As I am now in the process of looking for new opportunities, I want to take the time to thank everyone for the many memorable experiences and interactions that I have had during my time at [employer name]. [Explain how they impacted you and were positive/learning experiences.]
In conclusion, I would like to thank the company for the invaluable experience that I have gained while working there, and wish the team continued success in the future.
Write a resignation letter from someone with two months’ notice and expressing their gratitude for the opportunity afforded them while still acknowledging that they need to find a new job in another field.
This resignation letter is from David, who has worked at Karma for two years as a data analyst. David has two months’ notice that he will be leaving, but wishes to express the highest level of gratitude for the support, opportunities, and experiences provided by Karma.
On behalf of the corporate team at [employer name], I would like to take this opportunity to inform you of my resignation, with two months’ notice, from the position of data analyst.
Since starting my position here in January of this year, [employer name] has provided me with so many opportunities that have allowed me to develop my skills and grow professionally in a way that I had never imagined possible. While I will be sad to leave Karma, I feel that the time is right to pursue a new challenge and career path.
In particular, I want to express my gratitude for the many opportunities I’ve had to collaborate with colleagues from various teams to bring valuable insights to the boardroom. Additionally, I’m appreciative of the training I received on data analysis strategies, analysis tools, and visualization capabilities. I learned so much from the data team during my time here that I feel more prepared to begin working in a field that I feel comfortable in.
In conclusion, I want to thank the team at Karma for the many experiences and professional opportunities that I have been afforded. I remain confident in the future growth and success of your organization, and wish the best of luck to all in the years to come.
Can you help me write a resignation letter to my current employer, who has been great but that I need to move on because of my personal life and what opportunities they provided?
In recent weeks (or months), I have been considering a new endeavor that will require a significant shift in my personal life plans that will take me away from my current employer. [Provide as much context for your need to leave as possible (family or relationship conflicts, major relocation, etc.), but in this case, we don’t have specific details about the circumstances that require David to leave his job.]
While it has been a privilege to work alongside [name of coworker(s)], I have come to realize that I need to make a change due to personal circumstances that will require me to prioritize [provide a specific reason for your need to leave and the change required].
In the time that I have worked here, and with the support and guidance of the professional teams at [employer name], I have gained new skills, expanded my knowledge, and developed professionally to the extent that I am confident that I will be more successful in my new position.
While I am grateful for the opportunities provided and the personal relationships formed along the way, [employer name] has been a part of a life-shaping experience, and I am proud of the contributions made and accomplishments achieved because of my time working in the field.
Finally, I would like to extend warm wishes to the entire team at [employer name], both in my absence and in the success found there in the future.
This resignation letter from David, who has worked at Karma for two years as a data analyst, reflects that he was proud of his contributions and accomplishments while at Karma and leaves on cordial terms to pursue new personal goals.
In this example, David leaves because he needs to prioritize specific personal circumstances—an exciting and new position but also a significant shift.
It’s important to remember that in this case, David’s leaving is personal and not job-related, so even though there’s no specific reason to give, mentioning the personal reasons behind the leave could add a level of emotion and empathy to the resignation letter.
After David’s resignation, the

instruction: Use an appropriate format to structure a formal letter of recommendation for a student applying to a prestigious graduate program in computer science.
output:
Use an appropriate format to structure a formal letter of recommendation for a student applying to a prestigious graduate program in computer science.
Read the student's letter, and try to understand the student's goals, strengths, interests and weaknesses.
Identify how the student's strengths, interests and skills can contribute to the goal of a graduate program in computer science.
Remember to be objective, as well as to highlight the student's unique qualities. State why you believe that it is well-suited for the graduate program.
A strong letter of recommendation can make or break an application, and the formatting and content of your recommendation letter are essential to make a positive impact on the admissions committee, leading to a successful application.
Start your letter by clearly stating your relationship to the student, such as "Dr. Smith, I would like to introduce you to a distinguished graduate in computer science, Mr. Jones, who has taken one of my courses at the John Doe School of Technology."
Then, describe your knowledge of the student's academic career, as well as any extracurricular activities, research or projects they may have been involved in. Highlight the student's strengths, achievements and experiences that will contribute to the graduate program in computer science. Explain how these skills, strengths and experience match well with the program's demands and interests.
Next, describe the nature of your relationship with the student, such as how you know him professionally or personally. This is an opportunity to show that you have a history with the student, and thus you can speak to their academic and professional abilities.
Finally, state what you believe to be the student's potential contributions to the graduate program in computer science, as well as his or her academic, professional and personal growth with this experience. Remember to mention how this contribution will advance the field of computer science.
A formal recommendation letter can be a strong addition to the application, supporting the student's application. Be sure to use a professional tone, be objective in your assessment and explain how and why the student can excel in the graduate program in computer science.

instruction: Write a compelling product launch announcement email to inform our customers of our new software solution.
output:
Write a compelling product launch announcement email to inform our customers of our new software solution.
As the person responsible for the product launch, it is your job to manage the creation and distribution of the message. Here is how you can achieve the desired success.
Write a draft product launch announcement email to summarize the advantages of the new software solution. The email should outline a few key points about the product. It is important to present the key advantages the software solution provides consumers.
The email should make readers want to learn more about the new software. The goal is to make the reader believe that the new product will improve their lives. Here is where you make use of persuasive language.
The product launch announcement email is about making your software seem amazing. The email should convince the reader that they need the product.
It is critical to write the product launch announcement email in an engaging and creative manner. Do not fail to include a catchy subject line that is intriguing enough to lure the reader to read the message. Also, do not forget to list the product price and any special deals you may be offering.
The product launch announcement email should emphasize the quality of your product. Present the benefits your customer will get from using the new software. Here are some great things you should include in the email.
The email should answer common questions about your software solution. Include information about what products customers should use to best achieve their desired outcomes. The message must address concerns that the consumer may have about the new product.
After writing the product launch announcement email, you can choose to distribute it through your social media channels or send it directly to your target audience. Engage the consumer by asking them to subscribe to update through email or social media. Ensure to take advantage of this moment by making a call to action urging them to sign-up for your software.
The product launch announcement email is a crucial step in gaining consumer trust and creating interest for your software. Following these simple tips can help you generate your desired results.

instruction: Draft an apology email to a customer who experienced a delay in their order, and provide reassurance that the issue has been resolved.
output:
Draft an apology email to a customer who experienced a delay in their order, and provide reassurance that the issue has been resolved.
Include your direct email address in communications, such as for direct customer email inquiries or support.
Respond to customer feedback promptly with a genuine and empathetic response, focusing on your customer's concerns and alleviating any fears they may have.
Engage in frequent and ongoing communication with customers online to maintain strong relationships with them.
When building your email marketing campaigns, make sure to include a strong unsubscribe feature which allows customers to effortlessly opt-out of future emails.
In addition, ensure you provide customer support 24/7, especially if you're using social media for customer service.
Here's an example of a great apology emails from a hotel, apologizing profusely for an inconvenience in a booking:
An apology email should contain:
A sincere and heartfelt expression of regret
An explanation of the situation and why it took place
An outline of the steps your company has taken to correct the mistake
A commitment to resolve the problem, and what you'd do to ensure the problem doesn’t reoccur
Reassurance that the person's concern is appreciated and taken seriously
Resolution of the customer's issue quickly
Resolutions with personal touch
If you are sending a complaint email or other negative feedback, provide a personal touch. For example, you can use a specific name or reference.
Sometimes it's better to offer a discount as a small token of apology. It can still be helpful and show that you recognize the customer's effort.
You can also include ways to move forward. What would they want from you or the company to rectify the situation?
Create a customer advocate, a representative who specializes in customer complaints and would handle it before and after the initial communication. This could help to improve the quality of a customer-service experience.
The main aim of an apology email is to correct a mistake and resolve customer concerns. It's also essential to include an apology to the customer and state how the issue can be avoided in the future.
In recent years, it's become more important for businesses to recognize their shortcomings, and a prompt apology can go a long way toward a positive customer experience.
Remember, customer experience is the cornerstone for increasing customer loyalty, retention, and customer lifetime value.
In conclusion, an apology email to a customer is one of the most powerful ways to resolve customer complaints. With the right tone, personalization, and genuine apology, businesses can make valuable connections with their customers.
It's essential to take complaints and errors seriously to avoid negative customer feedback from spreading beyond the initial inquiry. By incorporating apologies, customer support, and communication in your organizational approach, you can maintain positive relationships with your customers, maintain your reputation, and turn complaints into opportunities for brand improvement.
A customer satisfaction survey is a valuable tool for collecting feedback from real customers, but it can be time-consuming to conduct and track responses over a long period. Here are eight best practices for customer satisfaction survey design:
Design the survey: Make sure that the survey is comprehensive enough to meet the needs of your targeted audience while being brief and easy to complete.
Target the right customers: Choose a small sample size of customers who can provide reliable information of your company's attributes.
Collect enough responses: Collect enough responses to understand the responses for the target audience.
Collect reliable information from customers: Make sure that the survey questions are unbiased, straightforward, and not too vague.
Encourage responses: Promote your survey through various channels such as social media, email, or phone. Be prompt at following-up, and make it easy for customers to participate in the survey.
Ask open questions: Open-ended questions are questions that ask for specific information and provide a wide range of answers such as opinions, preferences, or needs.
Ask closed questions: Closed-ended questions ask for specific answers to a limited number of questions. Closed questions encourage customers to provide detailed information and reduce the risk of non-exclusive answers.
Present responses and analysis clearly: Present raw survey data analytically and in plain words that are easily understood.
Be ready to take action: Finally, the survey data needs to be interpreted and analyzed to draw conclusions, but take immediate action when identified opportunities for improvement.
In conclusion, a customer satisfaction survey is an essential tool for gathering feedback and identifying customer needs. By following best practices, businesses can conduct a survey that collects valuable data and encourages customer participation.
A customer satisfaction survey generates reliable data about your customers' satisfaction levels in a concise format that allows for action planning to improve the customer experience.
The primary goal of a satisfaction survey is to gauge whether a customer was satisfied or dissatisfied by specific aspects of your service, and identify the areas that fall below standard. The survey, therefore, must include questions that focus on specific areas of service; these may include product

instruction: Write a script for a YouTube video exploring the history and cultural significance of jazz.
output:
Write a script for a YouTube video exploring the history and cultural significance of jazz. Use your research to explain how it became a cultural icon and the ways in which it continues to influence music and social commentary today.
5. Make a PowerPoint Presentation on the history of jazz music, highlighting some of the significant personalities in the genre. Share what you have learned with an audience.
6. Create a timeline of the history of Jazz music. Include the significant innovators and the cultural events or movements that occurred in sync with its rise. Use graphics, photos, and music samples to illustrate each category.
7. Create a poster, album cover or a collage on the history, style or evolution of jazz music by exploring its significant periods, iconic musical themes or instruments and legendary pioneers.
8. Research how Jazz music impacts other music genres. Use videos, lyrics samples and analysis to show how it influences and reflects the culture, values, and sentiments of various communities.
9. Write a research paper that looks at the music of the major jazz era, including how it was influenced by various cultural movements and genres.
10. Create a 10-minute performance showcasing jazz music through several period styles. Use your research to inform your choreography, dress, and style, and showcase an authentic performance.
This jazz paper sample is ready to inspire your research. Jazz is a rich, cultural icon. Its history is important and fascinating, and we hope you have found this jazz music research paper example helpful!
We offer an impressive collection of jazz research paper templates and example papers to help you with your college essay assignment.
What is jazz music?
Jazz music is characterized by its improvisational and syncopated rhythm structure and a mix of different cultures. It has its roots in African American folk music, that includes blues, jump blues, ragtime, and gospel music. It also includes classical musicians like Dizzy Gillespie, Miles Davis, and Louis Armstrong.
Why is Jazz important?
Jazz music has become a vital part of the African American identity and has helped to shape the African American culture. It also had a big influence on the history of music. Jazz music evolved in sync with the times, and its evolution was influenced by the social, cultural, and political changes of the times. With its unique blend of musical styles and improvisational themes, Jazz music still remains relevant today and continues to influence new music genres.
How is Jazz different from other types of music?
Jazz music lacks conventional melodies and has an emphasis on free improvisation. It features a mix of sounds from New Orleans jazz tradition to classic styles, with an emphasis on rhythm and syncopation, that is characteristic of Jazz music. Moreover, Jazz music features an improvisational structure that gives musicians the freedom to create their version of the songs.
How did Jazz music evolve?
Following the Civil War, the Jazz music emerged. It was influenced by blues, ragtime, and spiritual music. The New Orleans jazz style gave birth to jazz music. Later, musicians like Duke Ellington, Louis Armstrong, and Benny Goodnigh changed the jazz music's sound. The genre became more sophisticated with the incorporation of classical music.
What were some of the most important jazz styles?
The most popular Jazz music evolved to six styles. These include New Orleans jazz, Swing jazz, Bebop, Hard bop, Modal jazz, and Soul jazz. Different styles of Jazz music emerged during the different eras of the style evolution, each with unique characteristics and styles.
How much has Jazz music changed over time?
Jazz music has evolved considerably over the years. While the genre was first influenced by African American traditions, it became a universal genre that embraced a variety of musical styles. During the 1920s, jazz had evolved to a more refined sound thanks to the influence of white musicians, such as Duke Ellington. As jazz music evolved to newer eras, new sounds and themes were developed through experimentation and improvisation.
Who are some of the greatest Jazz musicians?
Louis Armstrong- known as "Satchmo," was one of the first African American jazz performers to rise to international prominence before and after the Second World War. Duke Ellington, another African American jazz great who had a career for more than 50 years. Billie Holiday, another notable performer and singer who influenced the Jazz genre's evolution through her interpretation of standards.
What are some important performances in Jazz history?
Various performances have been significant in jazz history. Jazz musicians that have created significant performances include: Louis Armstrong's "West End Blues" and "Chimes Blues." Charlie Parker's "Confirmation." Billie Holiday's rendition of "Strange Fruit." John Coltrane, who, along with Miles Davis, contributed to the modern-day Jazz era.
While writing a research paper on Jazz music, one could find it helpful to include some research tools like books, journals and articles. We have a set of recommended sources to consider

instruction: Compose an engaging travel blog post about a recent trip to Hawaii, highlighting cultural experiences and must-see attractions.
output:
Compose an engaging travel blog post about a recent trip to Hawaii, highlighting cultural experiences and must-see attractions.
What do students need to know about travel writing (with resources included)?
A high-quality travel piece needs to tell a story that captures the imagination of the reader. Think about the kinds of things that will make this happen:
A strong opening.
An engaging set-up.
A compelling narrative.
Emotional connections.
Cultural insights.
Detailed descriptions.
An intriguing character to root for.
An unexpected twist.
A satisfying conclusion.
What types of travel literature should be avoided?
Avoid cliché “what I ate” types of writing that all sound the same as “this was so good so I ate this much”. Avoid writing that’s overly long or dull — like a tour guide describing every detail of every scene.
Why is travel writing so important?
Travel writing is important for personal growth, exploration of the world, and cultural understanding. In their personal journeys, travellers may encounter people from different ethnicities, lifestyles, cultures, and religions.
What is the difference between travel writing and journalism?
While journalists report on the news from a neutral viewpoint, travel writers do so from the personal perspective, often as a way to share their observations and opinions about their experiences. In contrast, travel writing is more narrative and takes the form of short stories, personal accounts of exploration, and cultural experiences.
What makes a good travel article?
Good travel writing is creative, personal, informative, and interesting — and it’s almost impossible to classify an article or book as good travel writing if it lacks all of those elements. A good travel article provides details that are unique, original, and vividly descriptive without being too excessive.
Why do we need travel writing?
Because travel writing helps spread awareness about the local people, culture, and lifestyle of a place. There is a positive impact on the local economy as the people get more opportunities for their creative talents.
Who are some of the best-known travel writers?
Here are ten of the most acclaimed travel writers and their contributions that we could not live without:
Jack Kerouac (1922-1969) – On the Road;
John McPhee (b. 1931) – Coming into the Country;
Paul Theroux (b. 1941) – The Old Patagonian Express;
Bill Bryson (b. 1951) – A Walk in the Woods;
Michael Pollan – The Botany of Desire;
Paul Theroux – Saint Jack;
Bruce Chatwin – In Patagonia;
Alistair Cooke (1908-2004) – Letter from America;
William Maxwell (1908-1970) – The Chimneys of France;
Jack Gantos – Dead End in Norvelt.
What is the process of writing travel writing?
The preparation phase involves an extensive research and planning on the specific destination. Once the travel writing takes place, the writer must follow a structured process of gathering facts, creating descriptions and characters, and developing a theme or narrative. Finally, the traveller or writer needs to edit the piece from the rough draft into a polished finished work.
How can photography help with travel writing?
Images contribute to the writing process in many ways; they add depth, perspective and meaning, create a stronger story, or provide historical interest or cultural significance. In some instances, it may even be sufficient as a travel piece. Most importantly, photography can support the telling of the story, and also make the travel writing more engaging.
What is the most important thing to remember when writing travel writing?
The most significant aspect of travel writing is to tell the truth. An authentic story, free from hype or distortion is the key to create a connection with readers and maintain a credibility. So, it is fundamental to remember to keep a clear and honest perspective, while writing travel writing.
Why does travel writing matter?
Travel writing can change the perception of a place, the culture or the person. This art form lets travelers’ stories and experience get published, and it helps create an opportunity to bridge the gap between cultures.
Why is writing important?
Writing is an essential skill. It allows us to communicate our ideas, experiences, thoughts, and emotions, and in turn, helps to develop the crucial ability to organize our thoughts and express our ideas. Whether written for personal or business purposes, writing encourages creativity, critical thinking, and improves communication skills.
Why is writing important for self-expression?
Writing, in general, has an enormous impact on our mental development and personal growth, which plays an essential role in our psychological, intellectual, and social development. Writing provides us an opportunity to explore and express our thoughts, feelings, and experiences, while helping us improve self-awareness, self-

instruction: Write a captivating movie review for a recently released science fiction film, discussing its plot, characters, and special effects.
output:
Write a captivating movie review for a recently released science fiction film, discussing its plot, characters, and special effects.
To start, introduce the topic by describing the action of the film. Say something like, “An upcoming science fiction film released this past summer was created by a well-known director. The plot line follows a band of space adventurers set up in a new world as they fight their way through a mysterious evil force.” Then describe the characters in the movie and their roles. For example, say something like, “One of the primary protagonists is a rebellious ship captain named Jack Harper. He is joined by his loyal co-pilot Gemma and a talented hacker named Violet. Together, they work to fight off an evil force that has set itself up on a distant planet.”
Next, discuss the special effects of the movie. Talk about how they were created and any innovative aspects you noticed. Say something like, “The special effects in this movie were impressive. The use of CGI helped to recreate a realistic depiction of a distant planet. The action sequences, such as the fight scenes, were also skillfully executed, making the movie feel like a visually stunning action film.”
Lastly, rate the quality of the movie. Comment on any areas you felt it excelled in, such as special effects or directing, as well as any parts that you did not feel were as impressive. Conclude your movie review with a general outlook on the film you watched. Say something like, “This movie was an enjoyable science fiction adventure with engaging characters and exciting effects. The story was well-crafted and took the viewer on a thrilling journey that you know isn’t just another typical movie.”

instruction: Write a symphony concert review, discussing the orchestra's performance and overall audience experience.
output:
Write a symphony concert review, discussing the orchestra's performance and overall audience experience.
Use the following sentence starters as prompts for this assignment.
The orchestra did a spectacular job of playing all of the different instruments. The audience was absolutely stunned by the symphony’s overall performance. Each performer was in top form during this concert.
This is a 3–5-paragraph essay that is to be approximately three or four pages in length. Your score will not be affected by the length of the essay.
I. Audience Participation
The audience felt as if they were truly part of the performance.
The audience applauded and stood up and applauded many times throughout the performance.
They engaged with the performances in a profound way that made it truly feel like they were experiencing something special.
II. The Orchestra performance
1. The orchestration of the concert was superb.
This orchestra worked together as one, not just as a group of musicians playing in different sections.
There was a strong sense of synchronization that showed through.
2. The soloist was phenomenal.
The performance was not only outstanding but also quite awe-inspiring.
They engaged with the audience, and some even waved to various members in the audience.
III. The conductor and conduct of the concert
The conductor provided the orchestra with great direction, and it showed in their performance.
There was not a second wasted on these pieces.
There were no delays or hesitations that would break the momentum of each piece.
What was Your Experience?
Give a short explanation of your experience.
Do you feel like you have been to an entirely different piece of performance?
You may include the following in your discussion:
How this experience made you think differently about the piece you were listening to.
How the different parts of the orchestra played off one another, and how the symphony seemed like one big collective.
How the music affected your mood and overall experience that night.
This essay requires an understanding of proper essay structure and grammatical structure. Be sure to follow the APA guidelines for documentation and formatting of your work.
A variety of sources should be used, including music reviews, newspaper and online articles, online videos or YouTube clips of the performance, and any other literature (including books, articles, and interviews, as well as videos, etc.) that you deem relevant to the subject matter.
Use at least 2-3 credible sources in addition to your own notes and reflections, and make sure that sources should provide a context for your responses to the topics or questions.
Reference and citation style must be applied consistently throughout the assignment. In-text citations should include the author’s name, the page number (if applicable [for printed material]), and a corresponding reference in the reference list (see APA guidelines or your institution's preferred style manual).
Remember, a proper research paper involves more than just collecting a handful of credible websites to support your observations and evaluations. It’s essential to organize your findings and apply them coherently to your discussion, argument, or thesis.
How to format a research paper in APA?
Sample APA research paper structure includes:
Title page: this contains your name, the course title, instructor name, and the date.
Abstract: this contains a summary of your research paper.
Introduction: this is the overview of your argument you’ll be developing over the pages.
Methods: this is where you list out the methodology you utilized, techniques, and research materials.
Findings: this contains the outcomes you obtained and analysis of your data.
Conclusion: this contains summary of your arguments, a discussion of the implications to the industry or general audience, conclusions, and the implications for future research.
References: this contains a list of all the references you used throughout your research.
